text: Grabba Green is a worthy guilt free splurge. Great atmosphere, friendly team. The smoothies are the real deal, and come loaded with fresh, colorful ingredients. The juices are 100%. I enjoy the premade elixirs they have available.  Always feel invigorated after leaving. The pricing is fair and comparable to competitors Who offer the  level of freshness you are getting.

I have been here a few times and it is good (I wouldn't go so far as to say great). The downside is that it is crazy busy at lunchtime and there are very few places to sit so unless you are getting takeout you may have to stand at the long counters near the bathroom to eat (which could have high chairs but don't). Also, it is definitely overpriced. Ten dollars is just too much for the lunch portion you get. If it was $7 or $8 I wouldn't feel so ripped off and would be more likely to return. I probably won't be back. I just don't think it's that fantastic to make it worth the price.

Got the Gulf of Mexico salad which was tasty.  However the shrimp in the salad were not deveined.  When I brought it to the staff attention they explained they get the shrimp prepared from an outside source. Well obviously no quality control  but the salad it self was good but for $10 I expect the shrimp to be deveined.

DO NOT go here if you have Celiac disease or are allergic to gluten! I have been in here a few times and was very excited to find a new place that is supposedly 100% gluten-free right near where i live. Only problem is, this place is NOT 100% gluten free like they have posted all over their menu and walls. The first couple of times I went in for lunch the food was good. I noticed that they had oats as a breakfast item and mentioned my excitement to the girl taking my order, she confidently told me that everything in the store was 100% gluten free including the organic steel cut oats. I ordered the oats yesterday morning and for the rest of the day I had to sit by the toilet and was forced to leave work early. I called the store and asked them about it and sure enough, the girl on the phone told me that the oats were gluten free, but not certified gluten free (In other words, THEY ARE NOT GLUTEN FREE). This should be against the law to falsely advertise the restaurant as gluten free (100% gluten free listed right on the menu) when it is not. I am about ready to sue. I WILL NOT be back to Grabbagreen, and I hope you will stop serving gluten in your store or at least remove the label that says 100% gluten free so no one else has to experience what I went through.

Awesome food and quick friendly service.  New favorite lunch spot for a healthy and delicious meal.  I like to order online, so my order is ready when I get there.  Convenient to take back to work and could eat lunch here everyday.

Tried this place out for lunch today, overall good experience! I had the southwest and my boyfriend had the patagonia. The patagonia was a little bland, but mine was good! 

Also, if you are watching calories be mindful of the grains, I was surprised when I saw how many my meal had! I definitely want to go back a get one of their juices!

I go to this place on a regular basis.  Absolutely love it, nothing there that I haven't liked.  The menu is a great concept, offers a lot of variety of choices but also VERY healthy and clean and it allows you to have fun with it and create different combinations and see what you come up with if you choose to "make your own".  I have had the quinoa a number of times but usually get a smoothie.  

The service there, in my experience has always been fast and friendly and consistently great!

I highly recommend to anyone who is not just vegan or vegetarian, which I am not, but to anyone who is health conscious and willing to spend a couple extra bucks to put something nutritious into their body!

Make sure to check your order before taking it to go. I have had a wrong order multiple times where there's ingredients I specifically asked to not have due to allergies. Therefore the food is inedible and by the time I get all the way home 20 minutes away I don't have time to go back and get it fixed. SUPER ANNOYING

After working here I changed my entire lifestyle in healthy eating. This is such a great place to learn about health and the people I worked with treated me like family. Ethan (manager) is the nicest and sweetest guy I ever had for a manager at any job. Totally cared so much about me, his customers and his employees. 

I lost 15 pounds working here and my skin looked amazing. Everyone is up-beat and very personable. Love love love the salads. Favorite smoothie is the Vita Vamp! Talk about healthy food! Your skin, hair and body will feel better eating here. 

This place really helped me to eat healthier and everyone is very supportive in your health. 

Recommend it!

Great concept, great customer service, unfortunately if you're looking for an ORGANIC NON-GMO....their menu will trick you. They have a very limited  list of organic items, but not the potential they could have. Its really too bad its not an all organic kitchen, because even greens and fruit are harmful to everyone  if it contains GMOS.  Just a food for thought to every restaurant  owners... IF PICAZZOS ITALIAN AND CHIPOTLE MEXICAN can have NO GMOs... THEN ALL OF YOU CAN !

Fantastic. Not sure why I haven't eaten here before but the quinoa bowl with steak was delicous.  Fresh ingredients,  friendly staff,  I saw about 10 things I wanted to try.   Prices are very good for scottsdale.  Can't wait to go back. If you're looking for healthy options at a good price i highly recommend.

So i ran into this while on lunch and was excited to see a fresh juice spot. Been juicing for a lil under a week so i had an idea on what to expect. I was not disappointed! I did the create your own and ordered, cucumber & kale with bananas & coconut, along with the whey protein & something else but cant remember. Just know that it was delicious!! For $7 i was not disappointed in the amount i got. Its a tall cup, i think about 8-10 ozs. I will be coming back. Also the food options sounded great as well.
I love this place ! I have never had a bad experience. Food is always fresh and delicious. I do not feel it is overpriced at all because you have to pay for quality ingredients.
Yum! Fresh and healthy choices. Love their juices and smoothies as well as The "Tokyo bay". salmon mixed with brown rice, edamame, cucumber, carots, miso ginger
I dig it here. Best thing is ordering online. When I walk in to pick up my lunch I am helped immediately!!

Wow! Healthy and delicious! I feel so good after eating here. My favorite thing to get is the make your own bowl with quinoa, spinach, bean sprouts, feta cheese, avocado, salmon, and chimichurri sauce. Give it a try!

I absolutely love this place. I've tried a variety of the salads, bowls, and shakes - every single one I've tried I've loved. Everything is always super fresh.

On top of that they make great cookies, bars, and granola that you can buy in packs to take home. 

Their order ahead app is super helpful, I order off of it at least once a week on my way to work. 

If you have time to sit down and eat they have some nice outdoor tables as well as indoor you can sit back and relax.

Healthy, organic and locally grown! I got the Tokyo salad and it was good. I've seen reviews on here that said service was slow. But if you watch them make the food, it's not something they whip up. They are steaming, boiling each dish. As well as making the juices per order. If you are looking for fast service go to Mc Donald's. I know their drive thru is super quick. I wish they would open one here in Desert Ridge, maybe on High Street?! I would go there everyday!!

had an amazing meal here today; brown rice, shrimp, avocado, broccoli, cucumber, tomato, carrot, cilantro,balsamic flax and a banana mango smoothie with orange juice. so good! definitely would recommend if your looking for something healthy and filling
Great customer service and friendly staff! Delicious healthy options as well!! This will definitely be q good to restaurant for me as a quick healthy bite to eat.

Welcome to my new addiction. UGH! I went in today based on a friends recommendation. At first glance, the menu is a tad overwhelming. I looked it over and then once at the register, I asked for a few of their most popular items. One of the items recommended was The South Beach. Looked good to me. (I held the feta and added chicken). I was surprised to see it come in a "to go" box but....whatever.  I grabbed a fork and dug in. OMG! DELISH! I immediately grabbed a menu so I could decide what I was going to get tomorrow! 
Seriously, I can't wait to go back.  The food is a little pricey but when you consider most items are organic...you're going to pay more which I'm OK with.  If iceburg lettuce and Ranch is your thang, don't go. If you are into whole, hearty, healthy, green food....this is your place. .TRY IT! 
(BTW...love the ipad POS!)

I have been waiting for a healthy fast food place in my area for such a long time.  I went here for the first time this morning and ended up going back again for dinner.  They have acai bowls (which no one else in the area has), so I'll probably be back from breakfast.  

OPEN ONE UP IN GRAYHAWK, I love this place!!!

We brought our 20% off coupon and only got 10% for some reason. Register guy was new but guy who entered the coupon in was definitely a pro and must have figured we'd just get 10 instead of 20%. We'll be back to a Grabbagreen, just not this one.

A place has to be pretty bad for me to take the time to do this. This place is the biggest waste of money. I asked for the greenest pure juice they have. I was told to pick 4 vegetables- I chose kale, spinach, carrots, and celery. After waiting a ridiculously long time- I was served a half cup of carrot juice. The portion size is too small to fit the proper amount of greens and get a satisfying size of juice. You can get much more juice (and greens), better service, for less money at Wholefoods or another juice bar.  I expressed my amazement and dissatisfaction when they handed me my juice and was basically told, this is just how it is. I paid $20 for 3 drinks that were basically two big sips of carrot juice. This place is a rip-off. Don't waste your time or money. I went to Wholefoods after for a real green juice.
I've been drinking green smoothies for years now. I tried the green with pear and hemp. It was super watery and not worth the 8 bucks. Stick with whole foods juice bar or nekter. It was cute inside.

Mmm. I might consider myself to be health-conscious, so for all those of you who might be watching not necessarily your weight, but the ingredients you are consuming, this place is pretty nice! I absolutely adore the way they show you every single part of each dish in the description, and also how you can even choose your own ingredients. The downsides are the price, which is pretty high, and also the fact that not all of their ingredients are organic. Maybe I'm just being extremely picky, but I feel like a place with a name like "Grabbagreen" would use all organic products. I mean, I'm not that person who only eats organic things, it's just that this sort of restaurant should have organic ingredients. Besides that and the price, though, it's incredibly delicious, healthy, and pretty quick, with great service.

My new favorite smoothie and juice spot! This place has so many healthy and tasty options! My favorite smoothie is the Goji Go Go! The service is good and the place is cute and very clean. The smoothies are pricey, but worth the price to me because I know it is more expensive trying to eat healthy!
Just had lunch, here today... Wow... Great food, great service, great value... The indochin grabbagrain rocks the house!!
Disappointing portion sizes and bland food.

I was very excited to come and try out this new healthy restaurant. I was very unsatisfied with the portion size and price. The flavors of the salad were very good but for $11 I would have hoped for a bigger meal. I have not tried the juices yet, but they too run pretty price at $7 each.
The food was fresh and quit good.  I'll go back.  Although I think it's expensive for what you get.

If ever a place SCREAMED go away... high prices, lack of seating, and repulsive (look small) cardboard box serving containers...  That's the bad. 
The GOOD is that the box is quite misconceiving as there is a lot of food packed into this little box AND the food is quite good ... too bad as I won't be back because of the 3 HUGE reasons I don't like the place. 
There are SO MANY grab and go, choices out there, leading with organic & healthy eating with wonderful ambiance, comfortable seating, eco friendly plates or the large recyclable bowls with clear tops, with much better pricing. 
TOO BAD... I really wanted to like this place...

While visiting Scottsdale on business, I was circling parking lots to find something I could eat before a business meeting that meets my dietary restrictions due to food allergies, primarily wheat/gluten and vinegar.  This can often be a challenge when looking for a quick bite.

Fortunately I ran across GrabbaGreen.  I was starving so I went for both a bowl and a juice.  I generally grab quick lunches at Whole Foods or Central Market salad bars, which can add up real quick when paying by the ounce, so I thought this meal was good value.

I went the creative route building both my bowl and drink from the extensive list of ingredients.  The biggest surprise was to see Moroccan Harissa  as a sauce option.  I love spicy things and Harissa is one of my favorite vinegar free condiments.  While my choices were brave (noodles, spinach, peppers, pistachios, feta) the bowl turned out awesome and was very filling.

The juice menu was extensive, and my chaotic choices for a customize juice blend turned out equally impressive.  The service was also fantastic.

The result, I had a great meal, and felt great afterwards with no food allergy induced food hangover.  I wish this was an option in all the cities I travel to for business.

I discovered this place while visiting Scottsdale.  After several days of not being able to eat almost anything, I stumbled across Grabagreen.  I have to tell you, I loved it!  They have such a great variety of offerings.  I literally went back three more times in the next two days.  The smoothies and the breakfasts that I had were wonderful.  I just wish we had one in Colorado.
Great concept! Look forward to more and more organic choices. Also, please consider getting rid of the styrofoam cups and going with a more 'green' option.

I was underwhelmed my "Tokyo" selection. For me, it needed something with flavor.  Perhaps lemon or hmmm...not sure.  The texture seemed a bit "mushy" for me as everything was steamed.  Healthy, sure, tasty...the jury is still out and they might be a while!

 I will try this place again and hope I enjoy my choice much better.

The smoothie was really good and if I could, I would have tried each one.  Thinking about it now and must have another.  Yes, they are good.
I wasn't overly impressed...slow service...very bland without a lot of seasoning...overpriced... I was looking for a great healthy option to add to my dining rotation...looks like I'm still looking

I eat here a lot.  Food is great, employees are nice enough.  Ingredients are the best.  Delicious menu choices.  It would have gotten a 5 star, but a few times I've found things in my food.  Once I found a strand of hair and once a sticker label.  Both, unfortunate ,but I still eat here a lot.

My office decided to order in for lunch. They decided on GrabbaGreen. 

They do have alot of choices to choose from, even create your own options. However I was not at all impressed with the quality. The food is already prepared, and when you make an order they just grab from the salad bar and shove them into your box. I will say the amount of food they fit into the boxes is quite impressive. 

For my protein I ordered Chicken, It was extremely dry and over cooked, for 10 dollars a box i would have expected better.

Holy crap!  Just spent $30 on 4 smoothies/juices that were terrible!  Tasteless and bland.  I know what "healthy" tastes like and could've gotten better options at Whole Foods.  Extremely disappointed.  Not sure if their food is any better, but for what I paid for, I feel like I was definitely taken for a sucker.  It's been a very long time since I've been this disappointed and upset about a food and drink experience.

I stopped in the other day and had the most delicious quinoa noodle, veggie, and chicken dish. I was so happy with it, I am going back again tomorrow to try something else. I would highly recommend. The staff is friendly, the decor is nice and the menu is extensive. I love how they put the food in chinese take-out boxes. Please open one in North Central Phoenix!

I go here often and get the salads mostly. The Orange County is my favorite. They stuff the box full of vegetables and I usually take it to go home and dump it in a big bowl and eat it. I made the mistake of trying a similar place with the same type of food. Big mistake. I think portions here are great. Also, all of the nutritional information is available on their website.

Paid an outrageous $11.50 for an Orange County salad w/ black beans that tasted like what one might find in the grass catcher bag of a lawnmower. Whatever salad dressing there was had little flavor. Take your money to Pita Jungle or Flower Child if you're looking for a tastier and more reasonably priced vegan meal with better ambiance and presentation.

This new business is WONDERFUL.  We are vegans and looking for a place to have healthy food out, this more than met that desire. Staff were super nice, VERY welcoming.  The food was delicious.  Whether you are committed to a plant based diet, gluten free diet or just want to feed your body something good, this is your ticket!!!  I would give it 10  stars, if I could.  Wish Grabbagreens  were as plentiful as McDonalds!!!

Walking by one night during close with my friends, I was telling them how great this place was- to which I immediately retracted my statement as I watched 2 girls standing around and drinking DIRECTLY out of the smoothie containers. It was humorous reading the big sign saying, "CLEAN EATING"... With the glass background of the shift manager and the employee slurping down from the same container the customers are served. Quite a disgusting sight to see... Making the owners real proud ladies.
Love it! Best salad to go place in town! The kids menu is a perfect size for little guys!

I came across this place while looking for a late lunch between appointments today, when I found that the Whole Foods I thought was in the area had closed. I got a Power greens juice with a double shot of wheat grass juice on the side. The owner/manager Kelley was friendly, hospitable and helpful. Fair prices and many options for fresh juices, smoothies and food.

The organics are all labeled, everything was gluten free and the selection was vast. The 2 oz wheat grass juice was $4 (ouch!) but worth it. Had a great conversation with Kelley and another regular customer about great food documentaries (Forks Over Knives, Footmatters, Hungry For Change, Fat Sick & Nearly Dead). I'll come back to this place whenever in the area!

My review is only on their Acai Bowls, which is NOT real acai bowls. It is basically a acai smoothie with the various toppings. I watched them pour in acai juice into the blender with banana and ice...when in other places they blend pure frozen acai puree resulting in rich purple color and taste of acai. What I got was just a diluted acai juice smoothie. They also serve it up in a cup rather than a bowl. Needless to say, it was a disappointment and a waste of money for $7.
Friendly service but food is blah. I'm a huge salad lover and hard to displease with a salad but this one was flavorless and expensive for what it was!

I can only comment on their smoothies, which have all been very good (and healthy).

This place is not for you if you're not looking for healthy/real food. 

If they dropped their prices 10-15% on the smoothies I would feel better about going there more often (and giving them 5 stars).

Went in about a week ago for my first time and picked up a smoothie. Service was great, made it fairly quick and it was really enjoyable. Went in again yesterday, this time trying the food for lunch. I ordered a "Build your own" with avocado, chicken, rice, beans, peppers and more. Lets just leave it at "Amazing." I will definitely be there again!

Had lunch here today. LOVE the concept of the "build-your-own" box and food was tasty and fresh, but do agree with many other reviewers that it is just a bit too pricey for what you get. I think $7.99 would be a good price point that would make me want to return frequently.

This place is  a favorite with the folks at my office. We must order lunch, for pick up, from them at least three days a week. The "make your own" is the best for mixing and matching healthy food items.  Only downside is that there are long lines/waiting right at lunch time. We now call in and prepay before driving over to pick up.

Fresh ingredients, great flavor, friendly service!  Just a bit expensive at $10.50 for each box of salad.

I love the Gangham salad! This visit my bf had the On the Border salad. Both are very yummy.

Previous visit, had a carrot juice which was yummy, but for $8, that was the first and last time for that.

There are many choices for salads & healthy eating that are not as expensive so we tend to go to those other places more. However, when I'm craving the Gangham Salad with the steak, brown rice and chia seeds, we splurge and come here.

Great place to get fast healthy food, but I do hate how all the bowls are the same price. We ordered the Toyko Bay and the Gulf of Mexico. The Tokyo Bay was worth the $10 because it was delicious, fulfilling, and had salmon. The Gulf of Mexico was just an overpriced Spinach salad and it was bland. My advice is to read the ingredients carefully and make sure you're getting your money's worth!
Pretty darn good for a grab and go healthy restaurant. I love the moroccan Mac and cheese and some of their protein cookies!

I saw a review picture that said, "No Sauce. Dry Chicken".....?
I don't get the picture, but I think the customer misunderstood the concept.
THIS IS HEALTHY FOOD.
I love it here, I eat a small meal (Im sure that's been said too) and Im full for the rest of the day, and Im a guy who loves to eat.

TIP OF THE DAY -------- ORDER ONLINE, ORDER ONLINE, ORDER ONLINE!!!!
unless you have plenty of time to hang out, this is NOT fast food, it takes them restaurant time to prepare your dish (or box if you will), but it is worth the wait.

And if you are a juice or smoothie person, UR in ZEN!!! 

I didn't really get it at first, (the flavor), but now I am a fan.

Feel Better, Live Better! as my Friend Dr. Joe always says...LOL

Grabbagreen, where do I begin.... everything I have tried here is amazing, and the place itself is clean! My go to order is the Energy Elevator smoothie which leaves me feeling satisfied and healthy. The only downside to Grabbagreen is the extremely expensive prices for what it is:( I could buy a meal for the price of a single juice/smoothie.

I see what they are trying to do and I can appreciate it. There aren't a ton of truly healthy options around here that don't cost a pretty penny. I will give them credit for having more options such as quinoa and allowing you to build your own bowl/salad. 

But, for $10, I would expect better, bolder flavor. **Edit, I had posted about the legitimacy of the proteins being fresh, and the owner had messaged me. They use a steaming method to avoid any oils in the cooking process, which is healthy but unfortunately leaves the dishes a bit bland.*** The veggies they use are also simply steamed. It couldn't hurt to use some actual herbs and seasoning. 

This place is just a little overpriced for the lackluster flavor. They do source their ingredients from conscious/organic farms -- but I just wish they'd work on the presentation/taste.

Happened upon this place in my search for a kale salad for lunch. Place has a very healthy feel as you walk in (not my first thing when looking for food) but I decided to give it a shot. Menu looked appealing to what I was craving. Line was quick, staff was was SUPER friendly. She guided me through my virgin order. Got the Gangam city salad. Normally I read reviews before I try a place but was so hungry I ordered then sat to wait while I read reviews. I was worried as I read some of the lower scored reviews. I got my food and was delightfully surprised! It had ample ingredients, great flavor, plenty of dressing, and didn't take ages to get out to me. I  very pleased with my lunch choice and will be back!!

I wanted to like this place, I really did. I was so excited to try it out...they make meals like I do at home. My mantra is Grain-Protein-Fat-Green. It is what I do.

So first we encounter the bored girl at the cash register who really wanted to be anywhere but there. She swayed when she waited, her cat eyeliner made her boredom look arrogant & she couldn't wait to get our order taken so she could move on.

The area is cramped. It's still summer so eating inside is appreciated. We had women sitting at tables waiting for to-go orders & single men taking 4 tops. The rudeness in the patrons was personified doubly in the employees.

I truly believe it must suck to work there & that's why it's so hard for everyone to smile. NO ONE SMILED. Everyone looked like they were being judged constantly by the middle-aged, blonde-ponytailed woman behind the counter. They looked like they hated their jobs. And frankly, it made it feel weird & I wanted to leave. Like I had been invited to a dinner party where the hosts had JUST had a huge blowout fight before I arrived. Awkward tension.

So cat-eye girl wanted my husbands last initial because there were two "John's". So he gives her D. When they finally call our order they call "John" & two Johns stand up because the necessary D had been lost in communication. 

The food is bland. They offer some really great sounding sauces but as a green-eater myself I know a cup of spinach is drying to the mouth so maybe I would've done better to choose another green, or maybe when they use spinach they should make some allowances for the taste in their measurements.
My husband DID like his however, he did not have spinach.

It's overpriced. I can make the same thing at home for $2 per family member.  I would feel more comfortable paying $7-8 than $10. It feels like I have to be exploited because I like to eat organically. NO I DON'T!!

Now is it an awesome idea? YES! Do they offer a semi-quick healthy lunch alternative? YES! Would I go back? NO!!!

Three words for ya..... A MA ZING!!!!!!!
I didn't know what to expect when I tried it, but I'm hooked!!!

I stopped in late in the afternoon craving a healthy juice pick-me-up.
I ordered the Detox Juice in the smaller size, I opted for no ice as i assumed I would get more juice. 
The portion was so small!! For a total of $7 I would expect a bit more juice or use bigger cups and include the ice...

The staff was very friendly and the juice was tasty, but at this price point there are other juice bars I would go to first.

The only bad thing I can say about this place is the price. It is a little pricey, but I still go every week. It is so delicious. I would go with the Southwest. It is my absolute favorite, you can't go wrong. The mango salsa/sriracha sauce they have is so good, I wish they sold it. 

I have had all the juices, I really like the one with beets.

I have seen this place in north Scottsdale several times. So we decided to check it out for dinner. Had the so Southern California that had 
Quinoa Noodle, Chicken, Spinach, Red Pepper, Avocado, Cucumber, Feta, Mint, Balsamic Flax. Can I just say that it was so delicious! Went back for breakfast and never knew that healthy and delicious could be synonymous with eating. If you like healthy eating, this place is what you have been dreaming of. Oh and the app is a great touch if you are in a hurry.

I finally re-visited Grabbagreen. Although the owner did not return my call from the prior review, I still found a reason to go in because of convenience. To my surprise and delight, Leslie provided exceptional service, even going above and beyond by honoring discount cards that they were no longer accepting. It really pays to go the extra step. Sometimes we hear more of the bad than good- but in this case I wanted to recognize a job well done.
Seriously my favorite go to place to eat now a days. Ive lost 8 lbs. In 3 weeks. Probably eat here multiple times a week! The girls there are amazing and the owner is super nice. Check it out.

Finally a place to order healthy and FAST food! I got the Tokyo Bay and Pina Protein to share with my kids. My kids got the kids bowls with chicken, rice, and a veggie. All of it was great. My husband got a juice to drink that had kale in it and it was really good as well. We really were happy to find somewhere quick and healthy to bring our kids. They had a really cute short table just for the kids with chairs just their size. We will definitely go again! The only constructive criticism I have is that I hadn't been here before and was overwhelmed with the menu. The guy taking my order seemed annoyed instead of helpful when I asked what was good. The menu was huge so a suggestion or two would have been helpful.

I love having Grabba Green as a snack and lunch option. Last week I really wanted a GOOD smoothie, and Grabba Green was perfect. I enjoyed the "Feeling Fabulous," which is spinach, kale, avocado, cucumber, coconut, lemon, coconut water and honey. Hearty, creamy with a touch of sweetness. 

Previously, I've had the Indochin, which has Rice Noodles, Chicken, Cucumber, Bean Sprouts, Carrots, Green Onion, Cilantro, and a spicy almond sauce.
I've been to a lot of juice bars and this is by far the best I have been to. I'm going to be back for sure!!

Not too many places out there that offer genuinely "fresh" and healthy ingredients that don't require a sit down & order off a menu hour long lunch meal. But, there is Grabbagreen. Not as "fast" as fast food because they prepare your food upon ordering. But it is quick enough to grab on a short lunch break. I had the So Cal grain bowl and it was tasty & filling. (Only ate half) I loves the use of mint & feta in this dish to really give it a pop of flavor! Can't wait to try more on the menu!

If this place only served salads I would give it a 3. If they only made juices I would give it a 5. For that reason I gave it a 4. This review is solely based on the one salad I got which is the gulf of Mexico salad. The menu says avocado, uh no it's not avocado, its a creamy guacamole without any taste (pet peeve: when restaurants  say avocado and it's that fake creamy guacomole type) the dressing which I'm not sure what it is as the menu didn't make it clear lacks flavor and didn't really complement the other flavors. The juice on the other hand was delicious!!! Tasted fresh! I would definitely consider coming back here and trying the other juices. For the price of the salad I will pass on the salads next time and go for a juice!
Love this place! I cherish the healthy organic options. It's such a relief to see food and restaurants keep moving in this direction. Way to go Grabbagreen!

I love this place. Great for gluten-free.  Taste great too. I come here often. Groupon helped since it is a bit pricey. That's also why not the 5th star.  But I'll keep coming because it's good and good for you.

I have been in several times since they opened.  I love the idea of feeding my family a healthy lunch and have recommended them to many other moms.   I must have been in right after the managers read the review about their  inconsistent policies.  I ordered my one year old daughter(with severe allergies) her usual.  The cashier was very nervous and said she needed to check with her manager.  The manager came out and rudely told me that they could not make it anymore.  They all decided to be "consistent" and that was against their policy to change the kids menu.  She told me I could pay 2.50 to add the noodles.  Seriously?  I thought this place was started by moms that wanted better food options for their kids.  I hope they remember this if it is true.  Seems like it should be such a fun place to work.  Not sure why all employees walk around with their tails between their legs.  Guess if the bosses speak to customers in such a rude manner, their staff must really get it!!  Needless to say, I will no longer be recommending Grabba Green.  

Also, for the cost, did anyone notice they reduced the size of the box the food comes in?  Same price?  Kind of shady!

GO TO TRUE FOODS!!
My second visit was hit it on the spot.  I feel SO good after dining here.....I mean.. Drinking here... the Juice is quick and filling.  It's high octane fuel for your body and cells.  JUICE GOOD.

Was out running errands and I decided I needed a snack. What better way to beat a HOT day than with a healthy smoothie. Great food was expected but what I received was a lot more. I was greeted with enthusiasm and as I waited for my order I witnessed something unexpected. A staff that clearly loved their job. They were energetic, fun loving and clearly wanted to give their customers the best possible service along with high quality product. It was a pleasure to watch them work. I definitely will be back.

Fresh food and I like that they added black beans as a protein since I am allergic to soy and I'm vegan. I was also happy that they were able to look at ingredients for me and let me know which sauce did not have garlic. Service is also way friendlier than it used to be. If you like quick and healthy I would recommend them. However very expensive for super small portions. I am hungry 30 min later. Would be 5 stars if portion was bigger.

Really good stuff I love this place! I've visited two different ones and both were equally good. 

I sat for a while at both places and watch people bring little kids in to have a treat. It's nice to see parents changing the way they eat and also passing it down to their children. 

I don't know how long this place has been open but I hope they keep popping up more and more! I believe raw food is the way to go. 
I'm worried about the all timers and dementia epidemic we have going on. 
The Japanese don't have it I think we need more raw food. 
This is a great place to start. If you want to do a detox check this place out. I saw something about them offering detox paying by the day.

We frequently get lunch here for our work group because it's healthy and everyone can eventually find something here. Only 4 stars because about 1/3 of the time they get one or two orders wrong on our order. They have been better recently, but still occasionally mess up, but they always fix whatever was wrong. Overall though, the staff is very friendly and always accommodating to the changes we make to each order.

I'm really excited about this place. This morning was my first time here, but it certainly won't be my last! Great (and surprisingly fast!) service, all organic and fresh ingredients, an enormous menu with plenty of options to customize as you wish, and delicious end products!

I was immediately and politely greeted when I walked through the front door. I decided to order a Power juice and asked if I could get ginger added to the juice. The response was an enthusiastic, "Absolutely!". No problem with customization - AWESOME!

I'm actually a bit of a health fanatic, in philosophy if not always in practice. I've spent an awful lot of time preparing organic juices for myself, so I know what goes into it and I appreciate the ability to customize, especially with such a large ingredients list!

I was also (pleasantly!) surprised that my bill for a 12 oz. juice was only about $6 after tax. That's a whole lot of fresh, organic energy for only $6!

The juice arrived quicker than I expected and tasted really good. Not quite as heavy on the greens (spinach and kale, in this case) as I would have gone myself, but I'm always going for body-boost not flavor. The flavor of this juice could appeal to anyone.

I'm really very pleased with the total experience today here at Grabbagreen. They've got the whole Chipotle-build-your-own salad thing going on, which I LOVE; and they even bottle their juices for you fresh, if you like! (Bottled juices sell for $8 - still a deal!)

I'll definitely be back - maybe even for lunch today. I've been meaning to replace my every-morning coffee with something more energizing (and more healthy!), and I think this just might be it.

If you haven't been, stop by sometime soon! Grab a big fresh meal, a smoothie, or a Power juice, then go sit outside in the perfect AZ "autumn" weather beside a small bush (like I did). You won't be disappointed!

Super disappointing! We drove by and I looked it up on yelp to see what people were saying. My phone died pretty quickly so we ran in and gave it a blind try. 
   My 7 year old, who is an extremely healthy eater complained about the smell the second we walked in. The atmosphere just didn't seem to welcoming either. If it is your first time there it seems a little confusing. I ordered the French Quarter, the little man wanted the kids chicken and green, and hubby ordered the Tokyo. 
    Mine was...blah. Just really nothing there. The ingredients were not that fantastic, the flavor was super bland except for the ?cayenne? Which was awful! My sons was literally spinach with little chunks of chicken and some awful BBQ type sauce splashed on it. Why not just call it a salad?  Husbands was bland and underwhelming as well. 
    We all had iced green tea which was super strong brewed and not pleasant at all, pretty bitter. For the price of $35, I would have rather gone to whole foods and bought meals. I definitely wouldn't waste my time or money going back here.
   Oh, to top it off the staff was not very friendly and the two girls at the register didn't know what they were doing and had to keep running and asking someone else.

This place is AMAAAAAZING! I feel so healthy after I eat here. The food is excellent, and the service is timely and welcoming. One employee in particular, I think his name may have been Rob, made my whole experience. I told him what  I was in the mood for, and he pointed me in the right direction. I will definitely be back!!!

This is an incredible healthy place to eat where you can build your own meal. The wife and I had different meal and they were outstanding. The "Grab Your Own", on the menu is the way to go if you want to build a great low cal or higher protein meal. The taste is great and the staff walk you through all the options.

It is my first choice when out and about and wanting to have a mindful eating experience. I have eaten at the Hayden and Shea locations and both are good.

Grabagreen is a hit! This whole-food, gluten free option was impressive. Basically, you can order a predetermined dish or you can pick your ingredients. I had quinoa, shrimp, avocado, red bell pepper, kale, feta, and the avocado sauce. It was delicious. I also had to try a smoothie. In this case, I went with a pre-listed option: Look Lucious. The flavored were right on. The style of this establishment is quick and easy, order at the counter style. They put your order in a little box regardless so you can eat in or out. It's not very big but there are several outdoor tables too. 

I'll be back!

I went in and had a pleasant surprise. People from state farm paid for my meal it was awesome! Aside from that I will be back to try their other food items. I got the steak collard wrap which was light and perfect for a pre workout meal. I also got their PB & J smoothie.

Seriously, this place cannot get any better.  Firstly, the people are AWESOME!!! They took the time to go through the menu with me and to boot, remembered my name from my first visit!  That's some serious customer service and talent.  

On to the shakes, TO DIE FOR!!! So good and so refreshing and tastes beyond amazing.  I absolutely love this place and have been back a good 7 or 8 times since. Beware, you will become addicted.

Extremely flavorless and hard to eat chicken wrap. 
Acai bowl was a joke. I ordered the one with strawberries bananas and blueberry. I got NO strawberries and the acai itself was purple water. 
I eat acai bowls constantly and that is nothing like ACAI. 

Tip: Put more powder in your acai mix, it needs at least double. Sell Acai with granola and condansaded milk as a side option besides the fruits. 
Google ACAI bowls in Brazil. 
Refund unhappy customer, I just wasted $18 of food I will not eat.

This place just gets it right with food quality!  My entire staff at New Serenity Spa eat breakfast, lunch and dinner at grabbagreen.  It is very difficult to find good, quality food on the go and these gals managed to take healthy eating/living possible for on the run people like me.

I recommend both the food and smoothies.  I usually create my own entree but their menu selections are equally good.  

I give high kudos to this business!!  Thank you for opening up a restaurant that can actually benefit our health instead of most fast food restaurants that are loaded with low quality ingredients.  I will be back again and again!

Great for smoothes and juice! The atmosphere is awesome and modern. My only complaint is the food could be more flavorful. You can get great flavor and still have a very healthy meal by just adding spices. Overall though a great place.

Grabbagreen is awesome. I haven't tried their food yet, but their juice and smoothie menus are great. A little bit on the more expensive side since they use organic products, but you get a good amount of everything. 

There're a few things I prefer Grabbagreen over other places:
Gluten-free products
Organic content
AND most smoothies and juice are naturally sweet, no sugar added. For a few items that have strong tastes like kale, etc. they only add a little bit of agave, not a whole lot. And that is just so much heathier.

I will definitely come back whenever I come to this area.

What a find! We had an hour to spare before movies commenced! The staff are uber friendly and explain all if first time customer. I don't think I have had fresher food. I opted for the Mediterranean salad and replaced the peppers with broccoli...simply delicious. I had a cucumber ginger and lemon mint juice. This was less delicious but that's purely personal taste. I highly recommend a stop at grabba green!

Yummy!!!!

Loved all the choices!  Loved that they were all organic, fresh, gluten free and super healthy! Love, love, love!

I usually get the "power" juice/detox. So good!!!! 

Suggestion: You're business prides themselves on being "green" why don't ya change your cups And straws to biodegradable? If you're company is going to be green, BE GREEN! :-)

Also, fyi... if you're on a budget, save up... it isn't cheap. You may get sticker shock and they don't even have a punch card (they used too!! and they keep saying "something" will come back, like a new punch card or loyalty card or something) Sooo pricey but ohh so good! I would go more often if it wasn't so expensive. $$$21 dollars for lunch, ouch

KEELY N OF GRABBAGREEN .... I see from other posts you may be the owner or a manager. Can you please clear up where your veggies/fruit for your smoothies come from? Are they organic??

Being a chef, restaurant consultant and specialize in nutrition this place is a MESS! You are price gouging the consumer with small portions and horrible cooking of the few items you have to cook. I had a salad and coconut water and it was $16!!  The staff couldn't explain a "perfect protein" such as quinoa or why it was good for you and the noodles were hard! The storage is off and pressure cooking the meat makes for a bland product. I am sure there were good intentions but I doubt they had a true restaurant person helping them. Keep to juicing. It is less labor and the cost and convenience can be justified.
Good food! But portion for price is kind of high. That's what you get for Scottsdale I guess. But I did enjoy the quinoa noodles. Can't find that anywhere else.

As part of my "2014 Arizona Health Food tour" I stopped into grabbagreen a couple months ago after being told about it from a friend. I thought the idea was cool, nothing that hasnt been done a thousand times before in California and a few times here in state, but it boasted a healthy alternative to fast food, and for that I had to give them credit. When I stepped inside in the later lunch hours the place was packed so I thought "well good for them, maybe this is the real deal." I was wrong, after ordering a Southwest Grain bowl recommended to me by the less than enthused girl at the counter, and a "Power Juice", I took a seat outside for lack of indoor seating and tight quarters just arent my thing. somewhere around ten minutes later my room temperature food and juice came out, as soon as I opened the box I was underwhelmed with the presentation, a bunch of mush beneath a layer of weird colored sauce. Presentation isnt everything, so I dug in. foul. The blend of textures wasnt very appealing, the sauce was a bit much, but something had to help mask the bland food and disgusting breast meat chicken(?) that was so dry in almost just crumbled in my mouth without having to chew. I swore at this moment I'd never eat at one of these establishments again, a ten dollar box of nothing that clearly gained its following by telling people that its gluten free and "mostly organic". All hope was not lost though, I still had my juice. I am person that juices at home, so upon taking the first sip of this juice something is wrong, its an 8 dollar apple juice with a hint of kale, spinach and lemon. The experience was overall pretty awful, but upon doing some research I learned there was a second location that wasnt as busy, I saw this as a chance to give it another go doing a little deeper research(keep your eyes peeled for my review of their other location) I know first hand that sometimes one restaurant location doesnt do the brand justice. I would love to see this place keep doing well, but I think eventually people will catch on that they are paying a lot for a less than spectacular health food experience that swears they are your only option.
I come to Phoenix on business and I make this my morning breakfast stop.  The oat smoothie always taste great and fresh.  This place can be a little pricey however.

I recently started working in the Pinnacle Peak & Pima area and generally prefer to eat lunch from home. I have celiac disease, and finding a quick, reasonably priced, and desirable lunch option is difficult. It's almost like pick two of the above needs- I almost never meet all three.

That said, I happened across a coupon for $2 off my next meal here at Grabbagreen. I pulled up the menu online and was a little annoyed to see that they labeled everything that was vegan or vegetarian, but nothing was labeled gluten free. I also couldn't find allergen information on the menu. Just as I'm about to give up and label this place as a bust for my needs, I finally see the beautiful words, "Our menu is gluten free". Not "We have a gluten free menu", or even worse "We have a gluten free friendly menu". THE ENTIRE GRABBAGREEN MENU IS GLUTEN FREE.

Understand that this is a big deal for celiacs. Never in the history of ever has a restaurant given me so many options with no change of cross contamination. JACKPOT!

I ordered the French Quarter without red pepper. The shrimp are actually a reasonable size, and considering this is a $10 meal I am impressed by the quality of shrimp used. My only complaint on this bowl was that it was flat out overloaded by onions... I had to pick most of them out because I couldn't even chew a bite without crying from onion issues. NExt time I'll specify light onions, but the quality of their ingredients is awesome. Super fresh spinach, and some of the most flavorful avocados I've had since I defected from California

I plan on returning regularly and will be posting a fully detailed review on my own personal site.

I've tried just about every smoothie available on the menu and I haven't had anything I can honestly say wasn't good, refreshing or delicious (usually a combination of all three).

My fav to try would be the energy elevator, which has espresso, whey proteing, almond milk, cocoa and a few other goodies I can't remember right now.  Taste like an espresso drink with a hint of chocolate.  Not sweet at all but a subtle taste that is in the background.  

So far have only had hash bowl and veggie bowl.  Both very healthy and what I found to be delicious as well.  Now one has to remember that the veggie hash bowl is all about the veggies and kale, so you might want to ask for extra creamy avocado for a bit more wetness.

Haven't tried all their other items yet, but can't imagine them not delivering the same good quality that my sampling has.

And finally......keep in mind this is all about freshness, no preservatives, and natural ingredients.  It won'be be like a Starbucks caramel fattachino or the store brought smoothies that are loaded with sugar.
I had the immunization station and it was delicious.  Kept me full for quite a long time.  Spendy though.

If you are looking for a healthy, organic meal, this has to be on your radar. Quick and easy with great flavors. My favorites are the Gulf of Mexico salad and the South Beach salad. The protein bars are also a great snack. Little pricey but you get what you pay for and you are paying to NOT have pesticides and harmful chemicals here.

I agree with Emina. Small sloppy portion for $10. Add protein ( chicken, etc... ) your up to almost $15.  I don't mind spending the $ when it is worth it.  I've spent $10 alone on a smoothie in the past from another establishment.   Overall poor value.

First time in today.  I chose Southwest Grain: Quinoa (OPTED for BROWN RICE INSTEAD), Chicken, Corn, Black Bean, Tomato, Avocado, Cheddar-Jack, Cilantro, Yogurt Agave BBQ....it was good.  Full if flavor. Nice portion. $10.00 +. Went in for lunch just minutes before noon. Filled up quick.  If I go back I may stick to this dish. I will try juice next time for sure - prices seemed high on those.

I'm usually a huge fan of this place.  I used to go to the FLW location since it was closest to me, but I have switched jobs and the Shea location is much closer for me to grab lunch on my break.  I usually get the Power PBJ smoothie with almond butter, but the last 2 times they were AWFUL and inconsistent!  They've been very watery, bland and with large chunks of almonds in every sip :(  At $8 a drink, I haven't been happy.

They certainly seem short staffed as of late and I have waited for almost 20 minutes for my smoothie (the only person in line).  Something is "off" with their shop and the quality of recipes, so I guess I'll either go to the FLW location and drive out of my way or just stop in next door at One Stop Nutrition and spend a little less.  Bummer.

Was in Scottsdale for four days for a conference and came here twice. Loved having a healthy yet affordable option for lunch and dinner. Enjoyed rice bowls and freshly made juices on both visits. Wish we had a place like this in my hometown!
This is my favorite location! Nick and Cheridan always remember my name and just how I like my order. I think the food is even better here. My favorite lunch spot and super healthy too!

This is my absolute favorite lunch spot. 

Now I'm not a vegetarian or health nut by any definition of the word but this place is delicious. 

I love their smoothies. I tend to customize my own, but I love the Feeling Fabulous. The coconut water really makes it. 

From the GrabbaGrain menu I looooooove the Moroccan Mac and Cheese (with chicken!) and The French Quarter. 

If I was independently wealthy I'd eat here three meals a day.

Where do I start? I recently moved into the neighborhood  and was extremely excited when I noticed this place. I love a quick healthy option and this seemed perfect. Well, far from it. One evening I decided to try it out, checked their hours on the website to be sure they were open it was 8:30p and their site stated they closed at 9:00p. Awesome. When I got there 10 minutes later I walked in to the chairs being stacked up and food being put away. I kindly asked if they were still open to which the 6 employees standing around responded in unison looking around at each other, "uuuuhhhhhh, uuuummmmm....kinda."  So I'm standing at the door like an idiot waiting for someone to say "of course, we're open until 9:00p, how can I help you?!" But no, I had to make the first move to say  "well, sorry to bother you I guess I'll try this some other time" .  They said bye, GIGGLED, and continued closing up shop early. 

My second attempt was unfortunately forced upon me this afternoon. I'm a medical sales rep and cater several lunches per week and had a request for gluten free meals. Grabba Green came to mind so I placed a phone order. After providing my CC info I made a split second decision to ask for all sauces on the side. The employee became quickly and noticeably exasperated, literally sighing and speaking a million miles a minute telling me she now had to hurry and go tell the cooks that sauce was on the side, to which I APOLOGIZED, just before she hung up on me. I showed up, practically bagged my own food, and left.

If service was better I could see myself using them a couple times a week to cater these lunches (which typically range from 15-50 people and at about $10/meal that would be a nice bit of business for one order). I don't care how great/healthy their food is, the service is horrible and their employees are incredibly rude. If I were the owners I would be livid at the way these kids are representing my business.

This place was SO good! I have a hard time finding good gluten-free, but the whole place is gluten-free!!! I went with the power juice and the hash breakfast bowl, and it was not disappointing! It was so good and fulfilling.

I have visited GG about 10 times since they opened and the only reason is the good healthy food.  The employees are always rude and unfriendly.  So odd in today's business environment.  Everyone likes to be cheerfully greeted and have a pleasant experience.  I thanked the person when my food was delivered to the bar and I didn't get a look or response.   The troubling thing is that this experience has been consistent over the time that the place has been open except for our first visit when the 2 ladies that opened the restaurant were behind the counter.

I wanted to try Grabbagreen again for a healthy dinner.  The young lady who helped me was very helpful and made alot of great suggestions. I ordered the Indochin. A quinoa pasta,chicken and veggie box. I had a slightly spicy sauce on it that was light and not overwhelming. I enjoyed it and want to try other things on the menu.  I'll be back, because like everyone else I'm trying to find places to make healthy choices. :)

Food was amazing. The guy at the counter taking my order was rude and felt the need to rush me. There was no one behind me and my first time there. Could not give me advice and upset I stepped out of line to look st the menu. I would of purchased more if I had the chance to look. I'll be back bc of the food.

Great place to satisfy an afternoon need for a treat. Smoothie, juice or small dish. I love this place. They just expanded their store to shea and Scottsdale -- making my drive to visit grabba mucho shorter. Perfection. Lady who served me this morning was super nice; which was rare at the other location. Excited!!

This place is overpriced at best. Ordered an acai bowl and the Acai was watery. I basically paid 8 bucks for fruit. The workers were immersed in their conversation and it took nearly 10 minutes for me to receive such a simple item with only one other customer in the store. They ordered a hot entree in a box which looked somewhat heathy. The portions of that box were measly for the $10+ price they were asking. This place is not organic so I find it hard to justify their high prices for mediocre food.

Good idea, but food is bland and the chicken looks and tastes like it was microwaved or steam cooked....
The worst are the containers-cheap, non-recyclable and covered with a non-stick film or sorts. Even if you eat in you don't get a plate.  The prices are steep, especially for what you get....there are many reasonable options in Scottsdale by now, including healthy ones, so we definitely won't be back.

Grabba Green offers some good and healthy lunch options, along with being very convenient. I've had a few lunches here and I really like the online ordering system, it makes for an easy to-go experience. I really enjoy the "make-your-own" bowls where you can choose whatever you want to go in it. There's lot's of fresh, healthy, and flavorful options. I like that they have quinoa pasta as a healthy alternative to regular pasta. The quinoa pasta can be a little clumpy at times, but that is just the nature of the beast, if you've ever cooked it at home you would know. I've also had their fresh juice which is quite good and reasonably priced. Grabba Green had become a part of my lunch rotation due to the convenience, healthy options, and reasonable prices.
LOVE juice is amazing.  Refreshing and delicious.  I had an immunity shot as well.   My friend had the Immune Juice and it's great. Clean store friendly sweet staff.  I'd come back for sure.

Way overpriced for what you get. The juice was nothing spectacular. I also got a side of salmon which was served as greasy little cube pieces. It tasted and smelled very fishy and I ended up throwing it out.  The tables are right up against the line area with clunky metal chairs that are loud and screechy when you move them.

I stopped by after reading some great reviews. But also because it's one of the few healthy juice and smoothie places in North Scottsdale (which is kind of odd, right?) I spend most of my time on the east coast where juice places are on every corner and 'real' juice (like the green stuff) is sold in stores so it's easy to get. The menu at grabba green is robust, good selection. Maybe a little overwhelming for a first timer, but whatevs-you can def get what you need.
I ordered 3 smoothies, here the thing: they were so ice cold I could hardly taste the actual fruit and veg in them. ICE COLD. So either the ice weighed out the ingredients in the smoothie or the ingredients are very cold (too cold). Either way, not a lot of taste. That's a shame. And at 11:20am they were already out of wheatgrass. It's Monday, people....
I might try it again....but would probably trek over to try the new True Food juice add on instead.
Cococabana not at all what I expected! It tasted like the smoothie was made with rotten bananas and the ice wasn't blended there were still chunks in it.

$18 for a bag of spinach with watered down tofu, carrots, and about 10 edamae and a small 16oz watered down beet juice (lay off the celery, give me more of the hearty juices). 

I was not impressed. I ordered the dish thinking it'd be veggie and re-read it to see that chicken was halfway down the menu. I asked if I could sub out the chicken with tofu. They were super nice and allowed me to do so. 

I'm all for healthy businesses...but I think it was WAY too expensive for the taste value. My tofu tasted like an everything bagel. I liked it at first but the dressing was too runny to give anything else a flavor. Might try again...but the juice is just too expensive when compared with places nearby like Nektar. 

I wish you could return food like you can return clothes. I threw this salad in the trash the moment I got home with it. Sorry.

I got the "Gulf of Mexico" and wound up paying $10.80 for a small box of spinach. Also included: cucumbers, bland eggs, and boiled unseasoned shrimp. Apparently "seasoning" to Grabbagreen means dumping cayenne pepper over a few flavorless ingredients and overcharging for it. Overall this was a total miss - completely bland and tasteless. Never again.

Perfect in so many ways... Let me count them!

1.  Perfect portion. I am not overly full, and I am not hungry anymore.

2.  Perfect preparation. I asked to create my own bowl, and they definitely created it just for me. For example, they flash steam the broccoli... It's not pre-cooked! And the bowl is a perfect balance of protein, rice, vegetables, and dressing. I could taste the dressing, but it was not drowning out the other ingredients.

3.  Perfect variety.  Where else can you get chicken, brown rice, beans sprouts, avocado, red pepper, broccoli, cucumber and balsamic flax dressing in one dish?!  You get five vegetable choices, and there must've been 20 to choose from!  And everything was super fresh. 

4.  Perfect service.  The guy and the girl working tonight were delightful.  They were able to answer every question of mine without hesitation and were extremely patient as I made my choices.  I also asked to try two dressings, and they had me try a third one based on the two I had chosen! 

5.  Perfect price. All of this for $10!

I've been to Grabbagreen a few times and I have only ordered their drinks, which I thought were nothing special but were overpriced. Yesterday, I ordered a salad from there togo because I was in the area and I was very disappointed. My salad was bland and just not very tasty. The girl who took my order was nice, but the other employees were not very friendly. I work nearby and I don't think I will ever be going back to Grabbagreen after not having a positive experience here.
Glad to have found a healthy juice/food place I can get lunch at! And yes, I totally "cheated" and got the kids Mac 'n cheese... Makes me feel better on days like this.

I Love Grabbagreen and have been eating here since they first opened. The food is fresh, organic and tastes great. Their chimichurri sauce is really good. The owners really care about the quality of the food and their customers.

The products is great! Tried the Acai cups and it was really good. It tasted very fresh and healthy. Also tried their PP&J  protein cookie which tasted very good and filling. 

Good products but customer service is sucks. It felt like the people who worked their hated their jobs. They did not greet me when I walked in or said thank you after I purchased my food. They we so glum ( if that's even a word). So, it's minus one star for the so-so customer service.

I heard so much buzz about this place and wanted something healthy. I got a quinoa box with salmon. However, there was only a few small flakes of salmon in my box. Disappointing. The quinoa with the sauce was a little spicy. I got the sesame. It was a decent lunch size portion. Not anxious to go back.

I really really really want to like Grabbagreen.  I have now been to both locations a total of 3-4 times so I have tried.  I am accustomed to paying a lot for food as I travel and Grabbagreen could fit right into an airport for overpricing.  I also am used to paying more for fresh, organic salads / food.  That said, I have never left that I was not still starving to death. Today  I paid $10 for the make your own salad which contained approximately 1 1/3 cup of kale, 1 T grated carrot, 1/3 cup black beans, 1 T grated beet, 1 T bean sprouts, 1 t mint and about 2 T of dressing (these are generous estimates).  They would have also included probably about 1 T of feta cheese but I am vegan.  I asked to sub in another vegetable or another herb to replace the cheese.  I was told that due to "policy" I could not do that but could pay an extra $0.75 for a t of herb or T of vegetable.  Now I am a consultant and engineer so I decided to run a little experiment, knowing full well that the cheese was one of the more expensive items and that they were financially ahead to honor this request especially since they tout vegan, vegetarian and gluten free options.  I went to Whole Paychecks and purchased the exact same ingredients.  Then I calculated how much was in my salad and what the food cost was.  Now this was paying full and marked up retail so a good bit more than they pay.  The food cost I estimated without the cheese was $2.66 which like I said I paid $10 for.  This was a 3.77 X markup which is healthy in the food industry.  The cheese cost was about $0.50 based on my numbers and was easily the most expensive thing except for the greens themselves.  So in other words they could have had both a happy customer and a lower cost salad for themselves if they were not so obtuse with their "policy."  Will I go back - probably but only because one of my buddies loves this place.  If you want  overpriced food and silly policies - go for it.  If not there are lots of other great places in Phoenix that will treat you better and provide better value.

Very addicting! The food is a health nuts dream, but so full of flavor that picky eaters will be happy.

The juices are terrific. They are fresh and flavorful. My 7 year old loves them and the food. She eats her veggies without complaint. She even asks to come here.

Grabbagreen is The only restaurant where I have had the most amazing salad that I actually ended up buying a second one. The manager is awesome! He operates a smooth, clean, friendly and very tasty restaurant. He is five stars all the way!

The food is extremely bland and overcooked. Healthy can be flavorful, tantalizing, and delicious, but the dishes here lack inspiration. 

The rice and noodles in the dishes are overcooked. The vegetables are edible, but lack seasoning. The dishes feel forced and put together in a rush without any creativity behind their creation.

Yes, Grabbagreen has smoothies too. I tried one, the experience was better, but still far from the best I've had. The berry smoothie tasted oddly like artificial grape flavoring.

The driving feeling I took away from my meal here, is that the dishes were created by someone who has been removed from a real wholesome meal for far too long and believes, wrongly, that these abominations pass as a fulfilling meal.
Amazing food and service. Nothing like it around. The food tasted fresh and my smoothie was the perfect consistency.

The worst pile of mush in crappy containers I have ever had. The place was filthy. The food is actually inedible. I wouldn't even feed to my dogs. Then again they eat raw vegan and organic. This place is a hole. An hour of my life I'll never get back and $40 for two bowls and two juices of all which got thrown away. GG is a JOKE on anything healthy or nutritionally orientated. It's really too bad that people are so desperate for "healthy" food or no longer have taste buds from eating so unhealthy that they really think these boxes of crap are good. You know, my bad though. After seeing how filthy it was, no greeting upon entering, being handed off to the sweaty guy who couldn't even look us in the eye to take our order, because I think he was too busy worried about the sweat about to roll down his face, GROSS! I should have walked out. The only thing they have going is location, I think. I live in Cenpho and generally can't stand anything in NS, because as I have found out it always like this. Pseudo trendy, subpar food and crap service to wannabe's. Oh, they hit the nail on the head. Here's my suggestion for anyone wanting to try this place, Grab onto your Greens, shove them as far in your wallet or pocket  as possible and save your hard earned money for truly great healthy food. Take a drive to the SE part of the city and see how Pomegranate Café gets it right.

Love the idea! We need more places where we can get some healthy eats and drinks!
Smoothies and Juices ($7) are great and they have tons of options (squash, beats, ginger, avocado, peppers, gogi, peanut butter, almond milk, coconut water, coco, etc.). You can also make your own. They sweeten most of their drinks with organic raw blue agave. 
Eats ($10) were a little disappointing. This is where the three star rating comes in place. My husband got the Indochin which is a more of a noodle bowl. The flavor was very similar to curry, but doesn't say that on the description, so if you don't like curry don't get this. I got the Gulf of Mexico which was a salad. The shrimp is raw not grilled and the avocado cream is more like mashed avocado. Coming in, I expect it to be healthy; however, being healthy doesn't mean lacking in flavor. I wanted to grab some salt and pour it all over my healthy salad! Not good. I love the concept....so I will be giving it another shot.
Customer Service: Employees were quick and helpful!

I'm so happy there's an awesome smoothie shop so close to home! They have so many good for you smoothies, I haven't tried the food, but they are one of the few places (like whole foods) that uses amazing ingredients. I spent 7 bucks on a smoothie but it was well worth it, and not filled with sugar filled sorbet like jamba.

I have been a repeat customer for many months now and go at least once a week. It is definitely a more expensive place, but so are all healthy and organic options. Their ingredients are fresh and staff is always prompt. Even with a line, you are sure to get in and out within a few minutes! 

I have ordered their smoothies, juices, and food. Hard to narrow down my favorites but I never leave without grabbing their pre-bottled "Power" (spinach, kale, apple, lemon) and "Wellness" (carrot, strawberry, apple lemon) juice! Those two taste amazing and are the perfect consistency.  The smoothies are more like meal replacements and I haven't tried one that I didn't like yet!

As far as food goes, I have only tried their Tokyo Bay, which was pretty great. The only issue I've heard is the amount of food crammed inside the box, but let's be honest... Who doesn't want more food? They definitely make sure you get your money's worth; although sometimes I wish it was less rice and more protein. 

Their Grabbagreen application has been a great way to order food and have it ready to be picked up when I arrive. It's very easy to use and navigate between the menu options. Only problem I had was there was no place to redeem a gift card at checkout... I have mentioned to the staff, but nothing has changed. Regardless, great idea if you are in a hurry! 

Noticed there has been an improvement in the staff and their customer service lately which I hope doesn't change!

This was my second visit. I really want this place to do well so I hope they make the necessary adjustments for improvement. It seems obvious to me that mornings would be a busy time. There were 2 employees but only one was making food- the other went to the back when it got busy. I understand juices & smoothies take some time - they need a better system to manage more than one order at a time. I was sad to see that a place so new had FILTHY cabinets (they had been open for less than an hour so I doubt it was from that day). The food is delicious and I really want them to succeed. Please schedule staff appropriately and maintain a level of pride in your appearance. I want to remain a loyal customer!

Finally, a go to place for healthy choices offering organic and gluten-free choices but a disappointment, over priced and overrated...  Seriously, we are talking veggies here, unless they can truly justify that it is because they offer organic ingredients only?  Staff was very helpful and friendly and accommodating but c'mon, a little price adjustment would be most helpful.  I recently discovered the juice bar at Sprouts for $3.99!

As much as I like the food, here are some issues I have encountered while visiting.... Music is WAY too loud... You can barely hear the people taking your order over the blaring stereo.... There needs to be a disclaimer noting that the food is NOT safe for celiacs, nor for people with peanut or tree nut allergies. There should be a calorie count on each of their food and drink items they make themselves as well... This should have been done long before the establishment even opened... And someone should have investigated the actual "gluten free" menu and stated it was not safe for celiacs to consume.
Again, I do love the food and the acai bowls and a couple of the drinks, but I really think some of the things I stated really do need to be addressed, or, have disclaimers on the menus about allergies.
My purpose of updating my review is to help them, not bash them... Overall the concept is wonderful, and welcome in a little shopping area of fast food garbage.  If this were my company, I would want input from consumers to help me be a better establishment and to listen to consumers wants or suggestions.

Finally a place where I can customize any of the menu items!
I am dairy, egg, gluten, almond and pineapple intolerant so typically it is impossible to eat out unless I want a salad.  
I especially like the cold pressed juices.  They taste so much better than Whole Foods. Plus if you buy 6 you can get a punch on your smoothie card.
Taylor (one of the managers) told me a discount is available for bulk orders for a juicing cleanse or just to have plenty on hand.  
All of the employees have been helpful and patient in the two months that I have been coming here.
Extra shoot outs to Mandi, Taylor and Brian.  :)
Thanks again for helping keep me healthy!!

If you're accustomed to shoveling massive quantities of food into your pie-hole and want a $5 super-size lunch this probably isn't your kind of place...
If you appreciate quality and also value your health, this place is an excellent choice. The food was really tasty and made from whole organic ingredients (I had the Tokyo Bay).  The menu was a bit confusing at first since they don't describe what type of food you're getting (sandwich, salad, etc) but once you figure that out you're set... The fact that they'll email you the receipt is a nice touch and keeps your wallet from getting too bloated.

This was all around  a great visit.  The young lady was awesome and guided us to a great. Smoothie.  All I had was a smoothie but they have food and they had customers ordering the food and all seem happy.  I got a smoothie that tasted like a carrot cake as our waiter said it would.  All around very strong!!!

I absolutely love this place. I'm from New York and was visiting family, my cousin took me here for lunch and it was brilliant. The service was great. The food was awesome (healthy and fresh) I had the  Tokyo Bay and my cousin had the Patagonia dish. It was awesome. Really hoping to find something similar in NYC.

I have updated this review multiple times because it's so hit or miss. One day it's a 5, the next visit, barely a 2. 

I've been here twice in the past two weeks which has been the first time in a few months. When it's great it's great, but when it's not, it's the biggest waste of $10. 

Last week I placed my order online and after getting my food back to the office I realized it didn't have ANY sesame sauce like I ordered, I sent a friendly email to let them know and NOTHING. Not an "I'm sorry" or "our apologies". The only reason I informed them is so they could do a better job training their staff. And, honestly I think if I'm paying this kind of money, I should get what I ordered. 

Yesterday, however, was spot on. Exactly as I ordered it and the staff was super friendly. Why can't you be more consistent? I would eat here more often with my coworkers if I was guaranteed to get what I ordered.

Every time I come here and get a Grab Your Own box, they do it wrong. I ordered brown rice, chicken, broccoli with the sesame flax sauce, and they gave me salmon. So I paid 12 dollars for rice and broccoli.
Still waiting, 10 minutes to make a smoothie and no thank you or sorry for the wait. I was the only one in the store. Completely ridiculous.
Way too expensive for a spinach salad w chicken. They should stick to making cleanses. Ill buy a salad from Safeway for 3.89 and not pay $16!

Now this places food is great for the most part, this location has always been pretty average for me. I'm more used to the Scottsdale and Shea location which is always a great experience, but after today I will never come to this Hayden location again. The employees don't interact with you at all. I never even was acknowledged walking in, no one said ANYTHING. There was a couple ahead of me ordering and the woman taking their order took about 10 minutes to take it, two other people had walked in by then and were standing next to me. It was very apparent us three were standing their first. Keep in mind this woman is STILL taking their order. Two more people walk in and another employee finally decides to come to the other register AND DECIDES TO HELP THE MAN WHO WALKED IN AFTER THE 3 PEOPLE WHO HAVE ALREADY BEEN STANDING THEIR FOR 10 MINUTES! I was in awe. So after he takes the guys order he switches with the girl STILL TAKING THE COUPLES ORDER and she walks away. Leaving all three of us still standing there 15 minutes later. I just walked out. And wasn't surprised when no one acknowledged me leaving either. One of the worst customer service experiences I've ever had. Congrats. One star for existing.

Delicious, great service, and the best part IT'S NUTRITIOUS! Great service too. They offer online ordering which works out great for me because I do not have a lot of time to take for lunch, as I am busy, busy! Thank you for this wonderful place!

This review is meant to be constructive.  I would generally submit feedback directly to the business site but I couldn't find anything on their site that lead me in that direction.

First time visitor with high expectations.  I understand the concept and what they are trying to do.  I appreciate the claim of quality, clean ingredients, local farms, fresh food on the go and all of that. With my visit and purchase today I don't feel like their quality standards were achieved therefore, there was little value in what I received and experienced.  

Ordered the South Beach.  I enjoyed the taste of everything, the blueberries were fresh and firm, beets were fresh, kale was crisp and firm, dressing tart.  Missed steps:  Soggy, slimy spinach, inedible beet exterior pieces, stems on blue berries, portion of chicken and blue berries was lacking and missing pistachios.  I discarded quarter of my salad that I found to be unappetizing or inedible.  I am happy to pay $13 for a salad that delivers on it's promise, this salad did not, and was definitely not worth the money spent. 

I'll try Grabbagreen again once the sting has worn off.  I'm intrigued by the rest of the menu and concept itself.

Just do it. Great quality food, the bowls are the perfect portion size, always delicious and fast service. The fresh juices are pricey but very good too. Healthy and yummy - one of my go to places when I am grabbing something quick for lunch. Love it!!

Thank you, I was in today and had a juice, ordered it with no lid or straw and took the cup to my own recycling. Thank you CG for the information about the Polyproplyene (Plastic) utensils, cups, straws, lids, styrofoam cups, bowls etc... Yes, these ARE recyclable. And read up on PLASTIC and ONE USE PLASTIC.
