There is no onsite recycling at the store, and there are way more sustainable options for utensils, plates, bowls, cups etc. ONE USE plastic is killing the planet and our oceans. All the cups, straws, utensils used at the restaurant go right into the trash and is ever recycled. Excellence is difficult and rare, and five stars is meaningful when it truly is five stars. Why not be excellent and in service of the entire flow of the consumer chain in a way that is sustainable and serves our whole planet? Great juice and lovely options. Can't wait to see the non plastic options. :)

I finally decided to write a review even though I have been coming to Grabba Green for a while now. The food is decent if you're looking for a healthy alternate from all the fast food places around here. I would love to give them more stars but their service is horrendous and slow. Horrendous because every time I go, I felt unwelcome. I believe in good customer service especially when your client is paying a ridiculous price for stuff they can make at home themselves. A smile would also be nice instead of having a f**k face all the time. Especially the red headed step-child dude. Maybe you should find another job because apparently customer service isn't your forte. Maybe it's just towards me because they seem to smile and seem helpful towards other people. I'd rather make my own salad and juice then ever come back to this establishment. 

Like I said if you like healthy stuff then do try this place out but don't expect a cheery staff to greet you that enjoys their job or act like they actually enjoy their job and don't expect fast service also.

First time Grabbagreen customer... 

My type of food all the way. Delish! Love the juices too. All very healthy AND organic which is important for so many reasons, one being it makes everything taste better =) This also makes things a bit more expensive, so it wont be an everyday trip for me, but definitely going back for more. Next time ordering either a juice OR a bowl, but not both. $19 bucks for my lunch today was shocking and hurt a little. 

Only suggestion... bigger food boxes please!  I opened my "So Cal" and I had to dump  everything into a larger container to eat because it was so crammed in there food was spilling out. Yay for portions, but not yay for the mess on my desk =P

I responded to Grabba Green's reply and emailed them... they never replied with the gesture promised on Yelp.

 Thank you for replying after the above review with a complimentary drink.  I appreciate the gesture.

I tried this place for the first time. I've been eating ketogenic for several months, so I eat quite a bit of salads, but you have to stay away from ones heavy on fruit. I wanted some variety over where I've been going, so I checked the menu out for this place online to see if there was anything keto friendly.

The Gulf of Mexico salad was 8 net carbs, great! Well, I walked down there, and the woman who took my order was very friendly. That is where you are getting your extra star. The décor was fine in a sheek kinda way, very limited seating. Free cucumber water was a nice touch.

Anyway, it took what seemed like forever to make my salad, there was only one person waiting ahead of me. I get it, maybe the shrimp was cooked to order, but these things were TINY, like popcorn shrimp you buy for a two year old tiny, which is absurd for a $10 salad in and of itself, but especially if that was what made it take so long. Crisp cooks chicken and shrimp to order and it is way faster than this place. They make like 10 salads to every one here. 

The salad was not mixed, no dressing mixed in, just things piled on top, so I mixed it all. I mean, I get some people don't like that, at least ask. 

So I decide to eat this thing. It was flavorless. The only thing that was good was the guacamole, which was probably a literal teaspoon. They used regular spinach instead of baby spinach, which I don't think I've ever had a restaurant do before for a salad. I certainly would never do that myself when making a salad. The red onion was sliced to between a quarter and a half an inch. I'm not sure why you'd do that for a salad, it makes it nearly impossible to eat without impaling each individual piece of onion with the fork. The whole thing was just bad. After a few bites I was really wishing I had gone somewhere else, but I'm not one to waste food, so I finished it. Not really filling, not good, 90% spinach, which was mostly full grown so it was more bitter than baby spinach. No redeeming quality. Kudos to whoever was working the register to get y'all the extra star.

You want a decent salad? Go to crisp? You want quick and good? Go to Panera. There are lots of options in this price range, and you can eat keto friendly without it tasting like cardboard. Go somewhere else.

While stealing coworker's leftovers from the company fridge and not getting caught is certainly an art form, it's not without its risks. Stuffing a large styrofoam container into the trash can is way too noisy and can attract co-worker attention, and, it's easy to spot. 
This is why I choose Grabbagreen.

Their leftover containers are the same used to serve their delicious menu items; a small, unobtrusive cardboard box - easy to boost from the fridge and stuff into the trash without attracting attention, and, usually just enough food to get me to the afternoon break.  
One small drawback.

Grabbagreen only sells healthy stuff, like quinoa and kale and such. They're big on smoothies too, although I've never sampled one yet since my co-workers never park them in the fridge. 
I thought about trying 'Ramona's' the other day when she went to the bathroom, but she's been pretty sick lately and I didn't want whatever it is she has. 

Anyway, I had some quinoa mixed with chicken, kalmata olives, red onions and red roasted peppers. Not exactly what I would've ordered but I'm not complaining since it's free. 
Miranda's leftovers, (name on box) were another story. Way too green. It looked like congealed snot with all that avocado. 
Not sure what it was.

So, I'm giving 'Miranda', whoever the fuck Miranda is, zero stars for her obvious lack of ordering prowess.
Ramona also gets zero stars, but mainly for coughing and hacking up shit all day and not covering her mouth. 
I'll be lucky if I don't get some kind of communicable disease. Jesus H. 

Grabbagreen on the other hand gets five stars, but I'm only going off the quinoa chicken thingy I stole from 'Katy'. What little she did leave behind was darned tasty, but then apparently she thought so too.

Anyways, I always overhear the girls talk about how expensive Grabbagreen is, but I don't happen to share their opinion. I think its extremely reasonable when treated as an office misdemeanor.

For now, I'll have to be content with them only going on payday.
I hope Ramona gets better soon. 
I really wanna try one of those smoothies.

This place was great! Love the healthy menu! The Quinoa bowl selections looked awesome so I can't wait to go back and try some more. I got the Santa Fe and it was excellent! The place is a little cramped and this is my only complaint. Would've been 5 stars otherwise.

Rip off. 
They give you a pound of leaves and save on other ingredients. $12 for kale and spinach is not worth it. I ordered steak and could count on one hand -the tiny pieces they put on the salad. 

Photo: trying to get to the ingredients. Took it all out of the box and I have a giant pile of leaves.

It ain't cheap eating healthy but these guys do a decent job of providing something healthy, filling, and at a decent price point.*  A great place to combat my hunger pangs next time that I am heading in the general direction of that New York style pizza place across the parking lot.



*Yes that is a jab at Flower Child

Smoothies are amazing! I usually get the immunization station and never have any complaints! Everyone seems really nice and always friendly!

Place does smell like doodoo, though!

Great place to grab a healthy lunch on the run. Their smoothies are super filling and good consistency - taste delicious and fresh. Salads are also amazing - overall speedy service, friendly and yummy! I'll definitely return when I'm in N Scottsdale. I had the PB smoothie - no changes and was perfect!

I book marked this place a few weeks ago and finally stopped in tonight to grab some grub on my way home from work. 

When I arrived, the gal who helped me out was so friendly and explained the entire menu. I decided on the Mediterranean Sea and was super impressed. This coming from someone who lives on chocolate cake, it (almost) pains me to say that I loved it and will definitely go back when I want something healthy for dinner.

When you're in the mood for delightfully healthy, wholesome, simple food, this place is a great choice. 

The Eat section if the menu allows you to combine a healthy grain, protein, veggies, dairy and sauce in an incredibly health combination. They also have a menu full of combinations - I highly recommend the Tokyo. 
 
I haven't tried the juices, but my husband has and he says they're pretty good. 

The portions aren't huge, but they're not bad for $10 and we always leave there feeling full and happy.

Cute new location, same great food!  This is the ultimate build-your-own place - super healthy, delicious, and as hearty or light as you make it, it's a favorite at our house.  They also have great juice!  

It's small, shiny and modern with a cute little table for kids and some nice outdoor seating.  A great place to throw in the mix when Pita Jungle's full.

They have some brilliant bowl combinations (I love the French Quarter, substituting sesame sauce for avocado cream), or you can make your own.  Tons of fresh, delicious ingredients and wonderful sauces:  combine a healthy grain/spinach, protein, veggies, dairy and sauce.  They have interesting choices like quinoa noodles and edamame.  Their salmon and shrimp are both really nice, the avocado is great, and I highly recommend using the edamame.

I got the energy elevator smoothie with cinnamon added in (recommendation of the cashier). Pretty dang good smoothie, but for $9 I think it's a little steep. They obviously use awesome ingredients and that's the only reason I can justify the price point but this definitely won't be my regular place.

I definitely have to say how grateful I am that this place is down the street from where I work. 

The smoothies are tasty and I definitely have enjoyed each one I have tried. 
It gets a little busy at lunch, so I try to swing by early to beat the crowd. 

It would be great to have a count of ingredients/calories that way you know what you are consuming. 

The only downside I will say, is that I understand customer service can be a little stressful, especially in a rush, however, I am paying $7.50 for a smoothie, not the attitude I get because I asked you if I could possibly add more banana into the smoothie. Whoever is at the register is generally hit or miss, some days you are a huge inconvenience and others you are the best thing that ever walked up to them! 

That aside, I highly recommend.

Every time I come here I want to love this place, but there is always an issue. Once I ordered a South Beach salad and because they were out of some ingredients they substituted things not normally in the salad without asking. This time I ask them to use raw nuts instead of roasted and now they do not carry raw nuts anymore!!!  Also, the orange cashew dressing (the only dressing without oil) is now made with roasted cashews!  I come here because I can eat completely "clean" and raw, now not possible. The other issue it that the place is slightly filthy. The sun is shining in and I see dust everywhere.  Both doors look like they have not been wiped down in a month and the transition plate underneath the door is gross!  Truly, I love the immune juice and as I said before, I REALLY WANT TO LOVE THIS PLACE!  Please, clean it up and keep things raw and healthy! Now they say they have never had raw nuts, always roasted. Strange, that is not what they said two months ago!!! Frustrating!!!!!

Healthy. Very healthy. It tastes healthy and it is healthy. That's not to say it's bad though! In fact, the flavor was pretty tasty, especially when I added the hot sauce to my salad. When I say healthy, I don't mean healthy tortilla wraps. They don't serve bread here so come in prepared to go bread-free. I ordered one of their salads which was stock full of avocado and other delicious veggies and chicken. It was really good, but I love bread so I would have loved to have the salad as a wrap. But again, this isn't the place to expect bread! I will definitely visit again if I'm in the mood for super healthy and I want to try one of their shakes or bowls as well.

Calling all vegans, pescatarians, protein lovers, and paleo enthusiasts. There is something for everyone here and order whatever delights your fancy without feeling guilty. 
Want breakfast but don't eat bread? Try their breakfast wrap made with a leafy green collards instead of a tortilla.  Even their breakfast sandwich is superb... using quinoa "cakes" instead of a biscuit/croissant.  
For lunch and dinner,  you can make your own bowl with choosing a variety of sauces then mix it with brown rice,  quinoa,  white rice, or quinoa noodles... or forgo the grain and make it a salad. Of course they have their designated favorite bowls so you don't have to design your own.  
It's quick and quality food I've been wanting for a long time!
Very tasty shakes and funny names...I had the la la luscious or something like that

I'm  visiting Arizona from Chile and my sister introduced me to Grabba Green. The service was excellent and the food is perfect, I get the PB&J smoothie and I have been craving it every day, in fact I think that I will have my sister pick one up for me now......... Yummy.

I had a salad and it was small and so expensive. Smoothies are expensive also. I can get most organic greens at Sprouts or Costco and make my own so much cheaper. I know they have to make money but come on! They should offer a smoothie deal cheaper for a daily special to bring more people in.
Perfect place for a fresh salad, juice or smoothie
Gluten-free menu, whole foods, all natural sweeteners. It's music to my ears. This place makes it so easy to get something  delicious, quick, and customizable to your nutritional needs. Love it!

Healthy, fast, delicious options always get a thumbs up in my book. Love the idea for GrabbaGreen. There are some pros and cons to this place, but I'd say it deserves 4 stars because it is so fresh and tasty.

The service is always good here, the people at the register are always informative, let me try dressing samples before I made a decision. One con is it smells kinda gross in there. Guessing from all the green veggies, which I love to taste, but the smell is just so overpowering. Also this place is overpriced.

The food is very good, I always get a build your own bowl. I get a vegan one with quinoa, spinach, black beans, and vegetables. They do give you a pretty big portion which is nice. Everything tastes fresh, and I have never been disappointed with my meals here!
Love the healthy, quick option for a substantial meal when on the go. Lovely atmosphere for sticking around to eat as well. Super friends staff! Organic, delicious food.
Had a yummy fresh pressed-juice. The menu looked delish. Will definitely be back!

Fresh and Delish! I am so psyched about this place to get quick healthy food- I walked in and was greeted immediately. I asked the gentlemen at the counter what he recommended as I gave him my dietary restrictions- he said the Patagonia was great with a ton of flavor while still meeting my restrictions. I ordered it and it did not disappoint! I love this dish!! So good and full of flavor for being healthy! I love that this dish is warm and has a fresh crunch to it! Perfectly prepared- Yes! 
Very clean and upbeat atmosphere- super friendly service! I'm making GrabbaGreen a frequent stop from now on!

Last weekend I was extremely tired and in search of green smoothie, this place came up on Yelp search. When I walked in I smelled nice fresh greens, then I realized I haven't eaten anything on that day.

Their menu is extensive, I took time to study each dishes to see what sounds good for my body. I ended up picking Gangnam city, for some reasons, red meat along with all the veggies listed on the menu sounded good.

Salad was very tasty, I thought I wasn't hungry but I ended up eating more than half. Normally portion size would have been perfect but I was suffering from lack of sleep and extreme fatigue. 

Salad and steak (protein) gave me just enough energy to get through my day, my body felt much better after eating something good for my body.

I would love to come back now I recovered from jet lag to enjoy their food and green juice.

This location not as good as some of the other ones. The ingredients were not fresh and did not take as good as the one on Hayden. Don't know if it was the guys working there or exactly what the deal was. Would not go back to that location

This has become my go to place for lunch and sometimes dinner. I try to eat and live a healthy lifestyle, and if you know anything about me, I succeed at it. If I don't bring my lunch to the office I usually go here as it is convenient, quick, delicious, and healthy. They are the only place I've found that actually serves Quinoa. I highly recommend this over sandwiches or fast food. Give it a try and you wont be disappointed.

I love what Grabbagreen stands for. I just cannot stand the staff that work at this location for the life of me. Very rude and they kept looking at our group like they were talking bad about us. There was at least 6 employees working the day I went and only one person working the register. There was 8 people standing in line and no one decided to jump in to help speed up the process and take orders. One particular black haired male employee was CHEWING GUM while making the food and gossiping with the co-workers instead of making the food faster. I was very grossed out when I saw him chewing away and hovering over my food... My boyfriend got us water and the water tank was filled ONLY WITH LEMONS but when it came out there was black stuff everywhere. We asked the black headed employee what could it be and he just rolled his eyes and said " I don't know" then walked away without offering new fresh water. So disappointed. I will be going to the Shea location for Grabba from now on.

Wow I am amazed of the great turn around this place has gotten. The staff is much friendlier and the place is very well kept! I believe my other review helped and now I love going there again! THANK YOU!!!

Great place... Truly tasty and healthy food. Great for a quick lunch or dinner!!  I highly recommend the So Cal with chicken... Atmosphere is nice and the owners are very involved and care about their customers.

So, occasionally in North Scottsdale, we get some really snobby South Scottsdalers - the stereotypical ones.  These are the hazards of living here.  I say this because it's really evident by some of the attitudes in some of these reviews, and, quite frankly, as someone who lives and works down the street (both less than 2 blocks) from Grabba Green, it's embarrassing.  If you had a bad experience, fine rate it low, but the whole world is not out to get you - get a grip.

I gave Grabba Green 5 stars, because for what they're doing, they're great at it.  I go here for a juice or smoothie each morning, and 90 percent of the time for lunch 'boxes'.  The staff is really nice, they move quick, and they listen - which is really important.  My juices are always exactly what I expect, as I've juiced a lot at home.  It's nice to not have the mess or constant trips to the grocery store, though!  There is also a wide selection of what you can add to your juice or smoothies, which I love.

The meals are a great value.  10 bucks for organic and whole foods, that give you great nutrition? um, yes.  I've always done a 'create my own' so I cannot personally attest to any of those that are recommended on the menu.  I can say that my own combinations were tasty and well cooked.  I also love that they have many different low fat sauces to pick from that are full of flavor.  It shows that the person who designed the menu put a lot of thought into it.

Grabba Green is a juice bar, with nutritional food.  If you're not someone making an effort to eat better (like whole grains and food rich with nutrients) it may just not be the place for you.  As someone who is actively trying to eat healthier, it's lovely to have it around.  Lastly, as to the cleanliness, it's always been clean when I go in.  

The only improvements I can suggest are that sometimes the morning employees look like they just rolled out of bed, but the blonde woman who usually works mornings, and appears to be the 'lead',  is always pleasant, well put together, and kind.  I'd also like to see them open at 7 AM during the week so I can ensure I get my juice every morning!

I've been jonzing for a acai bowl so I decided to give this place a whirl.  Very good!  I also got the energizing smoothie which gave me a little morning pick me up.  Those two items came to $16 - yikes...so I will be returning, just maybe not as much as I'd like to.
I highly recommend this place - ORGANIC everything. Owner is local. Very friendly staff. Fresh fresh fresh. So good.

First time there! Food was fresh but a bit overpriced. Seems like they're hiding the prices by having the price on the wall menu super tiny. I couldn't find it until after I had already paid bc I was in shock.

My husband, son, daughter and I visited for the first time Grabbagreen on E Shea Blvd in Scottsdale. My daughter has to eat gluten free as she has celiac disease and Grabbagreen is completely gluten free.
My daughter ordered the French Quarter: Avocado, Brown Rice, Cayenne, Parsley, Red Onion, Red Pepper, Shrimp, Spinach, Creamy Avocado Sauce  and she also ordered the Moroccan Mac n' Cheese: 
Chicken, Cheddar Jack, Feta, Quinoa Noodle, Harissa Sauce.
Every dish is made to order with only the freshest ingredients. My daughter gave me a bite of her French Quarter salad with a bite of shrimp--it was like heaven in my mouth.
The two employees were friendly and nice. We were greeted by them immediately upon entering and as we were leaving, they thanked us and told us to have a nice day. 
The restaurant is clean as are the restrooms. We will definitely be back to this location. 
Parking is plentiful and it is in a nice area of Scottsdale.

WOWZA! You know when I have my food contacts on speed dial, the food has gotta be amaze-balls and a top ten-er! When you walk in, the health attacks you and appeals to your senses.  The vibe is alive: the fit customers, the smell of fresh veggies and smoothies being prepared, the sound of the Grabba Greeners making your dish to absolute perfection and when your food is done being prepared ever so quickly, your taste buds will sing! 

The menu is endless. You can get food or drink (smoothies). As far as a bite to eat, I always get the same thing but I know there are at least 10 things I would like. You can pick the pre-made hot or cold items or you can make your own! Just choose your grain, protein, up to 3 super nutrients, low fat sauce, and dairy item. I don't eat a totally gluten-free diet but the stuff I've been reading about gluten says it's bad news. What'll ya know? Grabba Green's menu is gluten-free! I'm addicted to the "French Quarter". I don't love Red Pepper so they will substitute it for broccoli or anything I want without the fuss! They did mess up my specialty order once but I am not one to hold a grudge when they are always perfect and consistent in every way. As a side note, the "French Quarter is loaded with onion so you may want to have your tic tac ready.

I *do* think the price is a little steep for the small portion size but the health benefits and finding good, fresh food is hard to find so it's worth it to do your body good.  

I've seen places come and go in that lil' spot there. It seems to be a buzzin' there every time I go. I really hope that means it is going to stay alive.

This place is great if you don't have taste buds. I have tried so hard to like this place but their food really lacks. The service is always on par but there is no seasoning on ANYTHING. They have sauce but they won't give you enough to have any flavor. It's too expensive to taste as bland as it does. Do yourself a favor and go somewhere else.

Great place! Love the fact that their menu is Gluten-Free with lots of healthy options :-) Staff was very friendly and place was very clean. Bailey who helped me was super nice! They were very apologetic when one of my orders got messed up and they gave me a card for a free meal the next time I visit without me saying or asking for anything - now that's 5 star customer service!!! Also like that they partner with a charity to help kids! Definitely coming back the next time I'm in town.
Your new "packaging" SUCKS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Trying to stir a grabbagreen now makes a HUGE mess!  Go back to the box.  It's cute and functional.  IRRITATING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Decent menu if you are in a pinch and want something healthy. Been coming here since it has opened. Always fast...BUT there is a major flaw. I have always loved their smoothies, they are delish. Next time you want one, make sure that you READ the dietary information before you order. The healthy smoothie I love to drink is 450 calories, and has as much sugar as 2 snickers candy bars. As a matter of fact, most of the smoothies are not considered healthy at all...

The healthy version of Jamba Juice! I always come here for their smoothies, and my absolute favorite is the Feeling Fabulous. Their mac & cheese is awesome as well and is gluten-free!!! I do miss their protein on a stick...they should bring this back!!!

Tried the Tokyo Grabba and was totally disappointed. It is great that they are making healthy alternatives and it is unique but my meal cost me almost $11 and was completely tasteless and not filling at all. Actually had to go buy food after at the restaurant next door because my stomach was still grumbling. Although the food was totally bland and overpriced, I wouldn't mind giving it another shot for their smoothies and juices.

This disappointed me in so many ways. I have gone to multiple Grabbagreens but this one really dropped the ball. I decided to do a three day juice cleanse, that runs about $180. I was told my order would be done at 10:00am and it was... that was the end of the positive experience. I blame myself for not checking while I was still at the store, but they prepared the wrong program for me, which took some ignoring of the paperwork because we (the Mgr & I) reviewed both options & I was clear why I chose option one. I was told all juice & the "shots" were prepared fresh & they are good for five days. I picked my juice up on 6/27/17, with the intention of starting the cleanse on the 28th... unfortunately I wasn't able to start until the 29th... imagine my surprise when I realized my "fresh" juice expired on 6/29 & 6/30. By this time I was in the mountains with limited connectivity. On Saturday 7/1, I made my first call to the Mgr and was told he was not available, but would call me back. No call ever came. Once I was home, I tried again... and again the Mgr was not available. It is now 7/12/17 & I've never heard back & I just give up. This was an expensive lesson & a sad one at that... I am a celiac and Grabbagreen is a safe haven for those of us challenged by Gluten. I'll continue to grab my green juice, but unfortunately I can't recommend this particular Grabbagreen to anyone. $180 for juice & shots, set to expire within two days, makes for an unsuccessful experience & a very very very dissatisfied customer.
Ehhhhhhhhhhh I didn't like my Tokyo bay at all. The amount of salmon I got was a joke. The rice was so soggy I didn't eat half of it. Just a mushy box of gross.

Over-rated hipster joint. Hands down.

The staff looked at me like I was their red-headed step child. I AM, after all, over 30. They were friendly enough though, and was served quickly. The juice was quite expensive...$8 for a 12 oz. And it wasn't great. A friend had a meal and spent like $40 for a salad with chicken and two juices. Outrageous.  The pop spewing from the speakers was loud and obnoxious.

I will forgo Grabba Green in the future, searching for "greener pastures"! Lol

Expensive. Smoothies are okay. Salad was dry with very few ingredients. No dressing at all, so I was mostly eating dry leaves. When I asked for dressing they tried to charge me extra. Ridiculous, money-grabbing company.

I really love the concept and will continue to go here since there really is nothing comparable. However, I do think the restaurant could use some constructive feedback. I would not say the staff is outwardly friendly. Asking for recommendations from the intimidating menu don't really occur. The staff doesn't seem to know their product too well. I know that everything is made fresh, but it takes quite a while to get smoothies made. It seems like their productivity could increase if they used their assembly line a bit better. Ordering takeout? Forget about it. My order has yet to be right, dressing on the salads are paltry at best. Asking for custom made orders and usually there is an error. Overall, the food is good. Can't beat the healthy factor. But for a quick and consistent meal, they are going to need to make some changes.

I use to frequent this place all the time but the last visit I got the French quarter to go.  When I got to my destination tge shrimp was raw.  This time my order has way to many red onions that its unbeatable.   Ugh!!!  The who time I was there the employees kept saying there sorry to all the customers who were complaining.

I really wanted to like Grabba Green - it's very convenient to pick something healthy up on the way home, and my wife ate there a few times and loved it.  Stopped by last night (Monday) and there were only 2 other people in the store.  I ordered a French Quarter and picked up an Indochin for my wife.  Then staff was rude.  They took forever to get the order out and were bickering with each other - lots of confusion.  I  patiently waited, but wondered how tough this could  be with more staff that customers.  Finally got our food and took it home.  Well, the meals were all messed up.  My French Quarter and some sort of macaroni pasta instead off brown rice.  My wife's Indochin had brown rice instead of  Quinoa noodles.  My wife's spicy almond sauce was on my French Quarter and the veggies were all mixed up.  Very disappointing.  Obviously, no one was paying attention.  We contacted the manager who graciously offered 1/2 off our next two entrees.  So - they messed up two entrees but are only willing to give us 1/2 off?  No thank you.  There are a lot of healthy options these days for dining.  Ii'll hit Flower Child or Kale and Clover.  I want a nice experience and a correct order when I dine out.

I recently started the Paleo Diet and have completely cut out all grains and dairy.  Doing this has felt great but also made it very hard for me to find places to eat for lunch!  After talking with a friend at the office I found GrabbaGreen by Pita Jungle in Scottsdale and have been going back ever since.  They ARE expensive but their shakes and salads are amazing.  At first they gave me a small box for the salad and I felt as if I could have eaten two...then after finishing it I felt so full because of all the organic ingredients that I have continued to go back ever since.  Thanks everyone for making a fresh lunch option possible :)

I love this place. I am a massage therapist so I am always trying to find foods to eats between clients that wont make me tired after eating and keep me feeling full the rest of my shift. Its embarrassing to have a grumbling tummy while with a client. Gabbagreen has this. 
 
1. The food is healthy, energizing, and keeps me feeling full with out feeling like I over ate.

2. The portions they provide are just right and on some of the reviews I read people complained about the taste, well I got a sample of the dressings before I pick one so that way I pick one I knew I liked. 

3. The price is a little high but if you really think about it Gabbagreen is using fresh greens/fruits and even in the store those are not cheap... If you use cheap materials you will get cheap products... I just hope their fruits and veggies are from farmers markets/local farmers and not from a Walmart produce section.

4. The employees there were very helpful and I had great customer service. All of them had smiles on their faces and they treated the customers with respect. If people complained about this place than they were probably having a bad day before they can in. They should give it a second chance and if not than that just means we won't have to wait in line as long and find a place to sit next time we go in because it is always busy when I go in ;-) 

I just wish there was a Gabbagreen here in Glendale...

I eat a lot of salads so I was happy to find this place near my new home in Scottsdale. In short, I don't like it and will not be back. Most salad places mix your salad in a big bowl and then put it in a container from which you can eat it. This place crams your salad ingredients into a box without tossing them first and it is too small for the salad so you cannot mix the ingredients yourself. The container is also difficult to eat from with a flap sticking out from all four sides. There are no condiments like salt and pepper. Finally, as I am writing this, the employees are behind the counter arguing about shift assignments which is unpleasant from my perspective as a customer. In short, while I should be a regular customer as a salad addict, too much is wrong with this place and I will not be back.
This place is awesome and has helpful and friendly staff. Hunter was especially accommodating and nice!

Loved the Convenience of being able to get a good and quick lunch that consists of mostly veggies and super foods. My smoothie was Amazing! I got the Spiritulina! I appreciate every chance i can have spirulina! and its not that often unless i make it myself! The  Staff was friendly and my food came very fast! Loved it! im a new grabbagreen addict!

Ate here for the first time today and it was very tasty! The only complaint I have is that their avocado tasted a little off, but otherwise my salad was fantastic! The customer service was wonderful! And the atmosphere that they project is very energetic! I will definitely be coming back!

I Recently had a chance to check this place out, tried the Southwest and it was delicious! It was very well crafted and a well balanced dish. Also The juice is absolutely excellent! I will certainly be back as often as I can to try the different options on the menu. 

I was very happy with the helpful informative staff that were very friendly about answering the many questions I tend to have :). Also I think paying an extra dollar or two for fresh, delicious, healthy food is well worth it.

I would live to see one of these in the Tempe area!

Not really impressed with this juice/smoothie bar. The price is outrageous for an acai bowl that was small and not even good. I mean I could make my own and for another person for $7. Not only that the staff was very unfriendly and bratty. Definitely sticking to originals like Thrive that actually give you something to enjoy.
My favorite place to eat and I'm there at least once or twice a week. Too many favs to list. Staff is friendly and make great recommendations. I've never left disappointed. A+++

This is a great place to grab a juice, healthy bowl or smoothie.  Definitely great food, but the high school hangout with some of the night shift employees can be a bit awkward for customers.  Still great food, a bit overpriced, but excellent food with solid overall service.

I'm going to have to say that maybe my tastes are heavy but it was definitely a nifty fast food but more awesome type of dining experience.  They do super healthy shakes and food and have some great and unique selections that has opened my eyes to a different array of tastiness.  I got some quinoa noodles with some other fillings and was really surprised about the healthiness taste.  Perhaps I craze the butter and salt but this was wonderful food for the healthy and fit conscious such as myself.  I know I should eat good and this place could and will inspire someone to take the simplicity home and do it!!!  The price points are a bit steep but a new restaurant/swing in always has some growing pains and with time I think this place will definitely ramp up.  I'll be back fooooooooo sho and try the smoothies next time!!!

Mac and cheese was not good. I couldn't even fix it with hot sauce. 
Noodles melted onto your teeth and had a nasty after taste.

Giving GG two stars because I like the smoothies, food, and juices, but the prices are high for the amount/quality you receive. I was disappointed. Also, they sometimes have samples out (in this case it was a peanut butter bar), but they don't list the ingredients of said samples. I had a major allergic reaction to the pea protein in the peanut butter bars, which could have been avoided.

Grabba Green is amazing. I have a gluten allergy and am following a clean eating diet. Grabba Green is literally the only fast restaurant I can eat at. My favorite is the SoCal Grabba Grain but I also love the Indochin and Southwest. If you are expecting it to taste like most nasty fast food establishments, you will be disappointed. I think some other reviewers don't have a refined enough palette to appreciate the health benefits and delicious flavors Grabba Green has to offer. I eat here 3-4 times a week. I would eat here every day if they had a location closer to my house! You need to try it.

Very clean eating. So many food combinations that can be created it would take a while to get through all of them. Staff was patient with me since it was my first time. 

Will definitely eat there again.
Awesome spot. Quick. Healthy. Very helpful staff. Love the samples. Can't wait to go back.

Finally, a healthy, wholesome, fast-food alternative! I've only visited once and my family tried the French Quarter, La La Luscious smoothie, Feeling Fabulous smoothie and the Detox juice - all were great! The comments I read about the food being bland is probably because a lot of people are used to so much salt in their food, and here they don't do this. I felt everything tasted fresh and delicious! I could taste all the flavors of each ingredient listed in the menu of the dish we ordered. The kids were really digging the smoothies. Any health eatery is going to be on the pricey side, but if I have to eat out, I rather feel better eating here than saving a few bucks elsewhere. I also enjoy their smoothie and juice menu way better than Whole Foods. There are really great combinations, or you can make a custom drink for the same price...and the serving size is bigger :)

The place is pretty small and can get busy, but when I was there, the crew got everyone through pretty fast. I will definitely be back when I'm in the area.

Love this place, but I can't believe you don't have any plain vinegar.  All dressings have OIL in them.  OIL has saturated fat, yes even olive oil does.  You have such a HEALTHLY vibe going, so please offer us health nuts a healthy no oil alternative for salad dressings!  Just some balsamic vinegar would be grand,
Reference:  Dr. Caldwell Esselstyn's book, How to Prevent and Reverse Heart Disease, the documentary Forks Over Knives featuring Dr. Essestyn, the book How Not to Die by Dr. Michael Gregor, etc, etc.  Thank you!!
This is my go-to juice place in Scottsdale! Everybody who works there is super nice and the juice is very tasty!! I'd highly recommend it :)

Love!! So I just discovered GrabbaGreen. I work in the area and everyday I sit in my office for about 10 minutes trying to figure out where to eat for lunch, since I eat pretty clean. And I inevitably end up at one of the same two places eating the same thing. Well now I have some options!! GrabbaGreen has a pretty cool selection of healthy food, juices and smoothies. I opted for the SoCal and it was full of flavor. I'm a meat girl by nature and this is a vegetarian dish but it didn't disappoint. I also got to sample one of their smoothies (primi protein i think)...super refreshing.  Planning on trying one of their salads next.  Oh and the customer service was top notch. I was greeted by the owner right away and the entire staff was helpful and friendly.

I was looking for a healthy option and a friend recommended this place. I tried the so cal dish with quinoa noodles. It was extremely fresh, healthy and tasted fantastic. The menu has a ton of different healthy dishes, salads, juices and smoothies. I will be back!

I loved this place the first few times I went, because I'm all for fresh, healthy food. The Gabba grain bowls are really good if you make them right, and the pressed juices are good too but honestly the place is way to expensive for such small portions (I think they justify the price because it's organic.. But still). The inside sometimes has a very strange smell that makes you a little sick, maybe from cleaning solution or something, but it's enough to make you question the food. BUT, if you decide to go here for the acai bowl, it is a definite waste!! They are really gross and runny and taste nothing like a real acai bowl made with sambazon. They really jip you on the toppings too (which are not very tasty either) and mind you, I love acai bowls, so it was really disappointing.
This place is actually amazing.  I've been to quite a few juice bars, and this is one of my favorites.  Get the leafy!

People in my office go here all the time and so far I have only had a smoothie and it was really good. Everyone loves it so finally I went to the location. Its a little hole in the wall and VERY busy. It smells great and generally they are pretty quick. I had the indochin with out the cilantro. It was pretty good but lacked a bit of flavor in the noodles. I will probably add the soy sauce alternative they offer next time if I get this again.The chicken was good though. Its nice to get a bowl that tastes good and fills you up. Everything is gluten free so that's a nice healthy alternative to whats out in the world.

I will definitely go back to try more.

The smothie was great not too sweet. Service is great. The only reason they don't get 5 stars is for the Styrofoam cup! Come on you're suppose to be health conscious but put my drink in a toxic cup that will never decompose?

These people do not know what they are doing and I have to repeat my card number several times before they get it right which makes me mad and them waisting their time. They need to listen because I don't need to repeat my order for 3 times for them to get it. I suggest hiring people who know and understand customer service and how to be properly prepared and staffed well bc if ur always under staffed doesn't that tell u something that u should hire more workers?  Just a suggestion but I hate coming here everything is unorganized and not handled properly

I had pieces of blue rubber bands in my food. The employee tried to argue this was chopped cilantro. Clearly they blended the cilantro with the rubber band still attached. Wouldn't refund my food. 
Won't be back.

Well thought a different Grabbagreen might taste better. But I was wrong! Even when the food is made correct, without rubber bands in the food, the food is still weird. Not healthy weird, just weird. 

My box of noodles stayed in the shape of a box (in the box) and (out of the box) lol. 

I dumped the food out on a plate, when I got home and the food stayed in a solid box shaped square. When I went to eat the food, the noodles were part hard and part rubber. Not good.

It's Great. I Was confused by the name but was very surprised with the on the border salad I got. Big portion and the flavor surprised me. I always went to Pita Jungle, but a friend told me how good it was and I went. So happy to find a new place with fresh veggies and tasty chicken. I have a new place to eat yay.

This was my second outing to grabba green at Scottsdale Shea.  It's an easy place for lunch with a variety of options and flavors that borrow from Asian, Southwest and Greek cuisine .  I've tried the Southwest Rice Bowl and the Gangnam City salad.  Both are tasty with a multitude of fresh ingredients.  I love that you can have warm dishes as well instead of just salads, it makes it feel heartier.  The next time I'm back I've got my eye on the Moroccan Mac & Cheese.  

All of their food comes packed in a little brown box which is deceiving because there actually is a lot of food jammed inside.  I've tried their Juices (the Gingerly) which was fresh-made and delicious.  

I would say however, that I would never take my husband here because while there was certainly enough protein in both of the dishes that I have tried, I don't see it appealing to people who are very meat-and-potatoes.  We tried having lunch here with a few of our guy friends and they complained the entire time.

What a fresh and refreshing lunch spot. Super healthy. They are satisfying all of the LuLu Lemon lovers. The place has a modern clean feel to it. The green colored walls keep the mood levels up along with the trance and chill music. 

There's an abundant amount of choices to create your own lunch bowl. $10 is a fair price. They also have tons of smoothies or detox/juices. All you hear are smoothie machines grinding away to generate your drink to your pleasure. Steam is rising from the rice cookers for your bowls dishes. 

The staff are friendly and knowledgable. FYI, they will bottle and seal your own juices with a two hour notice 

One down side. Every dish is served in a brown box. I personally prefer a bowl since I chose to eat in the establishment. If half stars could be awarded than 4.5 STARS.
Love this place, had the Gangam City and it was a bento box full of delicious no bs greens!

The food is not only healthy, but flavorful.  If you want to make healthy choices in your life, start here.  I typically order one of the salads and have them swap out the shrimp for chicken.  The avocado dressing is amazingly flavorful.  I also like their juices and find them unique in that the few I have had are a bit tart.   The prices are fantastic ($10 for a healthy, nicely portioned salad with protein) and the staff friendly.
Large selection of juices, smoothies, and even healthy food.  I had a carrot, orange, cucumber, lemon, kale juice.  It was very good.  For a small it is about $6 but a good amount.

About a month ago, I started the juicing trend.  I wish I had the time to make all of my favorite juices, but I don't.  So when I work in Scottsdale, the go to place for me is grabbagreen.

I find their juices and smoothies to be very tasty....so much so that it is hard for me to have a processed juice from any store.  They are fresh and they don't have preservatives, which I find actually refreshing.  I am so happy that there is a place like this in my vicinity.  I can't even complain about the prices.  A little high?  Maybe, but it is a meal that you are having.  (And they have great rice and quinoa meals as well, btw)

My only complaint is the customer service.  They need to have more knowledgeable employees.  And I have been in there many times in the past and not once was I offered a punch card....I didn't even know that they had one until this past week.  I could have gotten a free smoothies 3 times over if I was told about this before.

You won my heart! OMG! I found my new found love at @grabbagreen. Their Southwest Chicken is to die for...of course, drizzled with Sriracha. Could only finish half of my lunch which was still the perfect leftover for the next day. Looking forward to coming back for more at #grabbagreen #imahappycamper #HealthyAndHappy all the way!

I was looking for a juice place for a light dinner and found Grabbagreen. I came to find that they also had fresh grain dinners and decided I'd try it out.

I was skeptical at first for the price of $10 for a small Chinese food carton sized meal. But the ingredients sounded good and I liked the available options. The amount of personalization was great. You choose a grain, a protein, 5 add-ins, and a sauce. Their pre-made recipes sounded great too.

Still skeptical off the amount of food for the price I dove into the meal as I was quite hungry. That was the most filling $10 I've ever spent. It was bright, fresh, delicious, and beyond filling. I could eat half of that for a solid lunch and save the rest for dinner. 

The sit down area itself was fine. But I would go back for the food, not the ambiance. I didn't end up trying a juice but I bet it would be great also.
Great concept. Super healthy gluten free food, fresh juice, and smoothies! Would return many times in a heart beat.

I went this past weekend for the first time in a few months. I used to work close by and was excited for them to open as there aren't a ton of healthy options in the area aside from Wildflower (which is always packed during lunch). The first time I went, I tried the Southwest, which is delicious. It came in a container the size of a chinese take-out container. When they first opened, they only had smoothies. I think it confused a lot of people that their tagline was food + juice but they didn't have actual juice. I forgot which smoothie I got but remember it being kind of icey and just OK.

I later went back on a hot summer day and tried their Energy juice which has pineapple, mint, coconut water, and apple. It was so good. I could probably drink that everyday. It's so light and refreshing!

This past time I decided to try their South Beach and got the Energy again. The South Beach's vinaigrette was a bit too much for me. I should have asked for it on the side. My boyfriend got the Boost juice. It was good but not very sweet. If it had apple or some other kind of sugary fruit in it, it would have been better for us. 

Their prices are a little higher than similar places. However, it's because they use organic ingredients. If you're wondering if they're actually a healthy place or a fake healthy place, you can go to their website to view nutrition information. $10 for a salad is pricey for me and not something I would do frequently. If organic is important to you, paying more wouldn't be a big deal. Overall, the food and juices are great, the price tag, not so much.

The food was good and the portions were nice just did not like the price, a bit expensive for a salad without a drink. Great location and dining area was kept nice and clean. I live near by so it's great when I wanna eat something healthy cause there ain't much around this area, just a lot of junk food spots.

This place is literally so gross. They have like no toppings, their menu is so annoying to read, and their dressings are bizarre. They have two choices for greens- kale or spinach, pathetic. And only two choices for cheese, TWO. And so I got "cheddar-jack" and this is what they gave me. Literally shredded taco cheese are u kidding. 

I was also the only customer in there and this guy literally took 25 minutes to make my "salad" I have a stomach ache even looking at this pic.

It's so bad, just don't.

I really like this place. Its tasty, healthy but its still a bit expensive. Still, the do a great job if you're looking for healthy and fast. I usually create my own bowl, which is nice, because I get what I want, and I love that they give you a good amount of the protein (specifically shrimp, in my case). I also really enjoy the agave bbq yogurt-delicious! And the smoothies are yummy too.My personal favorite is the Oxidation Elimination- lots of fruits-love it! I usually go to lunch here on Fridays, kind of a nice way to end the week and a healthy way to start to weekend.

Just walked in to this place and the cute young guy at the counter was more than helpful(even got a free treat). He recommended the green juice and this stuff was Sooo tastey. I ended up buying 6 juices since he recommended them and I cannot wait. If it's as good as the green juice I will be hooked and back. I love places that are fresh and delicious and this place is 5 stars. Would give more if I could! Enjoy All!!

I'm not a health food nut... But I love grabba green! The greens are very fresh and crisp and I love the quinoa & quinoa noodles.  The flavors are interesting and make my healthy lunch seem like a treat!  I usually choose chicken as my protein, but today I tried the beef and it was surprisingly tender and flavorful! So often, beef on a salad is tough... This was not!

One reviewer mentioned their greens were dry because of not enough dressing... I actually think they just give you too many greens. If you take the salad out of the little to-go box they stuff it in, it is a huge portion. I asked them to go light on the greens, or do 1/2 greens, 1/2 grain for the base and the proportions were perfect!

I've been to many places near my house for lunch, but o have to say this one takes the cake (not that they would ever sell that). Although I went there one time before and wasn't too excited about my previous choice, I went in a second time today. I am pleased to say that I have found my go-to spot for healthy eats in my area. Give this place a shot, you'll love it!

Great spot for a quick, healthy lunch or dinner! I've ordered meals from their 'Grabba Grain' menu twice, both were great! They pack a lot of food into those little boxes. The ingredients are fresh, organic, low cal, and they have some great combinations. 

So far the Southwest is my favorite. It had a mix of quinoa, chicken, corn, beans, tomatoes, avocado, cheese, cilantro and yogurt. Highly recommend! 

My friend and I ate here last night, I had the So Cal which was really good and my friend had to Tokyo Bay and said she liked it. The only downside - my friend tried the iced tea and said it was really bad (bad enough that she tossed it after one sip). Also, it would be great if they had sriracha to add to your meal! 

As an avocado nut, I'm def a fan of how many combinations come with avocado! Prices are a little high but reasonable considering the quality of the food and the amount you get. I haven't tried the juices or smoothies yet but they look great.
Kaitlyn and Thomas cheerfully made my favorite "Orange County" for me the other night, 4 minutes before closing, THANK YOU, it makes a difference.

I frequent Grabbagreen at the Scottsdale/Shea location, and have been a customer since it first opened.  The employees are wonderful.  I have often talked to management for answers to my questions when I am juicing.  I love everyone there -- they make an old lady feel so welcome.  If I ever have something that needs a tweak, they will gladly do it and with a smile.  All you have to do is ask.  When I see reviewers who complain about blandness or ask about a tastebud check, I wonder about your eating habits.  Are you eating clean?  Have you eliminated salt and fake food (processed) & carbs from your meals?  Do you eat animals?  If so, you need to do some research.  If you want to live a long life and become an old lady or man, you need to take the steps to eat healthy.  Your tastebuds will adjust.
I LOVE Grabbagreen! The staff is super friendly and the smoothies are delicious and healthy!
Love their selection of pressed juices! Plus their smoothies are huge and well worth the price... which is still very affordable for all the healthy ingredients you get packed in there!

We broke a tradition today and it sure was worth it! Every year since my daughters first year of school it has been a family tradition to go for ice cream on the first and last day of school....when I picked up my sixteen year old today she said she did not ice cream but instead wanted to try a new place she read about. So off to GrabbaGreen we went. In a land of high fat, high sugar, deep fried, frozen, processed crap on every corner, this place was literally like finding an oasis in the desert.  I had the French Quarter which I found delicious. The shrimp were delicious and not overcooked, the veggies were fabulously fresh and the creamy avocado dressing and abundant chunks of fresh avocado were just perfect. My daughter got the SoCal and loved it and her friend got the the Southwest and couldn't wait to come back with her family. 
One sure sign that the place is a hit was the line...the place was swamped. Yes, there was quite a wait for our food....consider the fact that this is a new business and I'm sure it will take some time to hit their stride. They are not throwing a chunk of some frozen nastiness into a boiling vat of oil and waiting for a buzzer to go off...they are making awesome fresh food and you have to think there is a little more prep involved. The manager was awesome and when we pointed out that our order was wrong, she comped the whole thing. That made for a win win situation for the customer and gave the business a chance to see what areas they need to work on as opposed to not saying anything then ripping the business apart on yelp with a nasty review! I always find it interesting when you see rave reviews on a restaurant and then read a random review that is just plain mean....obviously it stands out from all the others and you can't help but question the motive. 
As far as price, I will gladly pay a few extra dollars just for the option of eating fresh real food as opposed to the Frankenfood found on every corner. I can't wait to go back!!

Yum! Healthy food close by.... I usually get the same smoothie that I create and it's always made on time and the staff is always polite. 
Location is good and easy to get to. 
The peanut butter protein bar is dry but tasty. 
Even tried the kids Mac n cheese (quinoa) and it was good. 

Con: prices are a bit high, but it's good so I can't resist!
Smoothie was good and affordable and Granola was outstanding. And I had a lot of granola in my life. Wish we had one in Atlanta.

I had the French Quarter.  It was a tasty, well seasoned lunch.  I'm so glad there is a healthy, fast food choice!  I think the price is fair for the quality food you get.  I would rather pay a little more (and have a healthy lunch) then pay a couple dollars less for crap (and feel tired and groggy)!  I wish they offered house made, fresh iced teas and lemonades that were served in a big container (like some other places).  Speaking of containers, have you ever noticed how certain containers change the way things taste?  I don't think the little brown boxes do justice for the high quality ingredients.  I know they are recycled but I will be asking for a plate next time (I learned you could ask for one because the owner/manager replied to another customers complaint about them on Yelp).  Great ingredients, great menu, great seasoning, great lunch.

Finally! A "healthful" restaurant that is actually HEaLTHY! Great menu, fresh ingredients, friendly service. Prices on the entrees were fair and filled me up! I'm so happy to have this place in my neighborhood. I have yet to try the juices yet....prices seem a but high but I guess I'll need to go back and try them out.

Love GrabbaGreen! The food is tasty and healthy, it's convenient, and there's such a nice variety of ingredients! Only two complaints:  (1) I wish it weren't so crowded at lunchtime! (2) And this is important: I really wish GrabbaGreen would provide nutritional info, or at least calorie counts. I know the food is healthy, but the portions are large (as they should be, for the price), and as a small-ish woman, I'd like to know how much I should actually be eating. Because let's face it: Even healthy food can make you fat if you eat too much of it! Hope GrabbaGreen will take my suggestion to heart. Thanks!

The food tasted good,not great, definitely edible...the portions are very small.  Way to expensive for what you get. Also, everything comes in throw away containers and they don't recycle!!!!  I will never go there again.

Inconsistent. This is really important! Especially when aren't paying chump change for meals and juices. Listen, in case you haven't notice with all the pro-vegan places popping up in the city area, people are becoming more aware of juicing and clean eating. Yes, I choose to get a juice out every now and then, but I am fully aware that for the same $8-$10, I can hit a farmers market and get enough greens/frutis to juice for most of the week! I am paying for conveniences, so you guys really need to dot your I's and cross your T's here. 

- Portions are way too small for the amount of money being charged. Quinoa and tofu aren't that expensive people! 
- Inconsistently with freshness, don't ever serve an avocado if it's browning, just NO
- Staff aren't whatever somedays, it's really not a small thing, it makes me feel better about spending money if the staff is more friendly, as stated, I know I'm overpaying, its convenience. 

I'm biased to clean eat spots, but I can't let this place get a free pass. Well, in fact I am, because for what you get, this may be a 2 star. But the amount of shakes and combinations are pretty substantial, but they really need to tighten up here. Will re-visist in a couple months.

This place is so good and healthy!  The French Quarter is my fave--I like to add a bit more spice to mine and they will make it anyway you like. They even have a "make  your own" menu, which is a great idea. All fresh ingredients from local farms. The Boost drink is incredible and so flavorful and full of vitamins.

Those whining on here about "I had to wait 11 minutes...it was bland"--Suggestion to you--go to McDonald's or buy at Subway. Fresh food takes TIME to prepare and both locations are always packed no matter what time I go. I've started the online ordering and pick-up, as it makes it faster. 

Sure, it's not for everyone because ours is not a healthy culture---but this is a GREAT place. If you do care about fresh made food and helping local farmers try it!

Healthy, Fresh, Fast! What's not to love!!! Love all the GrabbaGreen locations in the Phoenix area! The indochin is my favorite grain option! The Gangnam city is my favorite salad. Or make your own, you can pick and choose from a huge list of local and fresh foods!
I've had a few different things and enjoyed them all. The Mac and Cheese, Santa Fe, and tonight I had the Tokyo Bowl. It was great. My only complaint is that the salmon is apparently farm raised.

I loved this place when it first opened, however, they have gotten my order wrong several times since and the portion sizes change all the time. Their inconsistency is a disappointment.. You never know what you're going to get!

I am NOT a picky eater by any stretch of the imagination. I am down to try anything. My husband sometimes hates it because I drag him along to try different places, where he enjoys consistency in where we go out to eat.

Anways...I was hoping GrabbaGreens would be in similar fashion to the fresh, garden-picked menu items I've tried before at other places (Kale & Clover or Pressed Juicery). Though my Orange County GrabbaGreen selection had all the ingredients I liked, I was suprisingly disappointed in the almost inedible flavor it had. I ended up throwing it away after a few bites (which I NEVER do). AND, on top of that, got sick almost immediately after eating. Not a pleasant experience....

It's unfortunate that I had this happen, considering they have a great, healthy concept going for them.

Maybe if I'm feeling a little compassionate I'll give them another try. For now, I'm sticking to the things I know are good (which my husband appreciates).

The funny thing about Yelp's rating scale is that I'm never quite sure whether I'm ranking it against my own personal experience, the options in the area, my lofty ideals for restaurants, etc. I know that's what makes reviews fun to read, but I also know that makes them subjective to some degree. Well, all that intro inside, I think that grabbagreen deserves 5 stars for the following (hopefully) persuasive and somewhat objective reasons: 

-There is nothing like it in the vast office park wasteland otherwise known as the Scottsdale Airpark area. Between Pei Wei, Wildflower and tons of other predictable options, there's not much to choose from for something simple, healthy and non-chainy. This is especially the case since the Whole Foods in the area closed. 
-If you live in the Silverlake area of LA or Seattle, places like this are a dime or dozen, but there are very few places in the Phoenix/Scottsdale area where you can get a good juice, smoothie or healthy breakfast/lunch and I think it earns major points for that. 
-The ingredient list for the drink and food options is comprehensive in my opinion. Avocado or squash in your smoothie, pomegranate or hemp in your brown rice bowl? Yes, please!

I know it's expensive and it's also got a douchey factor but then again, doesn't everything before it becomes a mainstay of an area? At that point, I think it just becomes hipster - or at least, run-of-the-mill/expected :)

I love this place. Whenever my wife and I want to eat something on the healthy side we choose grabba green. Their veggies and salads are so fresh you just feel good eating it. It is on the pricier side but I feel like it's definitely worth it. My favorites are the tokyo bay for veggies the gagnam green if I'm in a salad mood or the Moroccan Mac n cheese for a richer dish but still healthy with quinoa noodles and grilled chicken. The Sonoran breakfast sandwich is also a must try. It is on a quinoa cake that is really delightful.

Love the healthful salads here. Great ingredients, yet it didn't seem like my salad had much flavor, even with the dressing tossed in. At home, I often use EVOO as a dressing with a little s&p and a splash of vinegar so I'm ok with simple and healthy. But simple should have flavor. I think sea salt may have helped.

I will be back to try something else and hope to update my review then.

Grabba-green strikes me as Grabba-Greedy (sadly) and now I just can't recommend them anymore.

Let me explain. 

Up until about a month ago, I was massive fan of  Grabbagreen. Nice young (and very hard working) hipster staff. Wide selection of juices that are made fresh along with smoothies and a hot foods menu (never tried the food). 

Honestly I got addicted to the fresh juices and smoothies at Grabba and visited the Hayden/101 store  3-5 times weekly for probably 4 months now. I was probably spending $40-$50 a week here on my daily juice fixes (I ordered the carrot, ginger, kale and apple). 

But now they've lost me. I've found better. 

Here are my gripes now as I feel that Grabbgreen has become a victim of their own success:

1. The nice lady with the Southern accent that owns this place recently decided to stop allowing the hard working staff to make tips. Instead about a month ago she replaced the tip jar with a jar for donations to a charity. I'm sorry but these kids are making close to minimum wages - and dealing with a VERY VERY busy lunch crowd making custom drinks and working their asses off. 

Let me tell you something - this place is HAULING IN THE GREEN MONEY BY THE PRODUCE TRUCKLOAD. Can't you let the teens keep a few extra bucks for tips?

Shame on you.

2. A few months ago that nice Southern lady who owns the place also decided to change their punch card policy. It used to be that after 10 drinks you would earn a free smoothie. But now she changed the policy so  you simply get $5.00 off after buying 10 drinks. Gee - thanks.  

Always love it when the owner moves the goal posts mid game - especially when business is booming. Smart. Punish your best customers for their devotion.

3. The drinks here are are VASTLY OVERPRICED compared with a better option like Nekter in Scottsdale. Nekter's prices look to average $2.00- $3.00 cheaper for similar drinks of equal or better quality - with bigger portions. Yes I know they use organic veggies, but I assume they also buy in BULK and wholesale - not at the local Whole Foods. C'mon guys. Lighten up a little. 

4. Grabbagreen smells when you walk in. Whatever the hot foods are that are being cooked up, there is no getting away from the funky odors that permeate the place.

5. Drink inconsistency. I had many occasions over the past months where my drinks varied wildly in terms of  taste (too much apple at times, not enough ginger, etc)

Honestly, there are better juice options in this town now (as I said, Nektar is my new regular fave). 

And to the owner of Grabbagreen: Business may be sizzling now, but things can change on a dime in this town and the competition is coming on strong with... 

BETTER PRICES, ALLOWING THEIR EMPLOYEES TO KEEP THEIR TIPS, AND REAL PUNCH CARDS THAT STILL EARN A REAL FREE DRINK. 

M'am... Be humble and treat your workers and customers like gold - regardless of your initial success -  and you will have a business that will last a lifetime (rather than a flash in the smoothie cup).

So now I choose Nekter Juice bar. After trying Nekter, I suspect you will too.

UPDATE *** I noticed today the very long and detailed rebuttal from the owner of Grabbagreen to this review. To her credit, the response from the owner was intelligently written,  detailed, and put a 'positive' spin on my comments. Thank you. However the explanation about your removal of the tip jar still rings a bit hollow. If a huge operation like Starbucks with thousands of locations can find a way to help employees make a little extra $ with tips, then why  the issue at your particular operation? I think the issue is based more on your perceptions than anything else. Bring back the tip jar for your hardworking teens.

Yours words: "Grabbagreen removed the tip jar in part due to employee dissatisfaction regarding allocation of tips from the jar. Grabbagreen believed that all of our hourly employees contributed equally to a positive experience for our customers and that tips should have been distributed equally amongst them." 

Good - distribute the tips equally. Your the boss right?  Make an executive decision.  

Customers like me do NOT feel obligated to leave tips - we are accustomed to a tip jar and can handle it. People like me don't mind rewarding hard working young people. Regardless of whether you pay $10 an hour or $8.00... lets be clear. This is NOT a living wage. Could you live on $10 an hour? With health insurance, car and other costs? I think not. 

You are rationalizing your decision to withhold tips. You can do better - your business, employees and customers will thrive when you do the right thing. Thanks for listening.

Definitely my lunch time guilty pleasure....whether grain or green, you will be satisfied. I just tried a smoothie for the first time last week, I will be trying everything on the menu! It's my mission :)

It's pretty expensive so I don't go here very often, but I do enjoy the Energy Elevator smoothie. Today was the first time that an employee suggest I add almond butter and cinnamon for more texture (since it's blended with ice only) and it was even more delicious! I just didn't know it added another dollar, a smoothie that's practically $10! But I have it as a meal replacement for breakfast so that's ok. I once ordered the hash bowl and it was good BUT they shouldn't even call it a bowl. They serve the smallest portions ever and it's in a little brown box. Seriously, I was still starving after that and wish they had served something a little more like Chop House which is actually worth what you spend there. Anyway, this place is good. It's my place of choice for just one particular item.
I went back today and my experience was much better, I got exactly what I ordered and it was ready really fast! Things have definitely improved!

Love stopping in for a green smoothie when I'm in a rush and needing some additional fruits/veggies for the day! The service is great and they are always helpful finding the right 'taste' for you. It's always extremely noisy inside so I wouldn't recommend bringing work or meeting a friend, unless it's nice enough to sit outside.

I've been coming to both locations since the beginning.  The food and drinks are amazing.  Harry is one of the most polite, well spoken guys I've ever seen at a restaurant, and always takes the time to say something nice. Matt definitely has the place under control, runs a tight ship, is tuned in to what's going on, always remembers my name, and has the confident presence that you'd expect a manager to have.  Luna is adorable, has a beautiful, infectious smile, that can light up the world, and you can definitely see why they've selected her for the first impression when you walk up to the register!

I ordered the Mediterranean salad extra dressing on the side salmon on the side i cannot eat salmon my boyfriend does. 12 minutes later we get our food salmon on it no extra dressing. this was my first visit sad to say i have to go back out to grab something for dinner since they messed it up and no why would i wait another 12 minutes for a new one when they couldnt get the first they correct. I was excited to come back to try the mango breakfast bowl... doubt that is going to happen. Too many other choices around.

YUM!!! I absolutely love Geabbagreen and this location is perfect for me! Any restaurant who supports local farms and organic as much as they can, should always have high ratings. AND, any restaurant who supports different dietary needs, vegetarian, vegan, GF, etc, should also have a high rating. This is why I love Grabbagreen. It's so fresh, the local and organic support, the vegan options, and to top it off, it's delicious. I've been here a few times and have had a wonderful experience! My favorite is the Grab Your Own, try it with quinoa, spinach, black beans, avocado, broccoli, kalamata olives, topped w/ Orange cashew. Yummy. It's fresh, fast, and healthy. Can't go wrong!
Tiny portion of food with no flavor. I was the only person there and they got my order wrong. Just skip it and go to the Whole Foods salad bar, you'll get more and better food for less $

I am not joking:  STEAMED STEAK. I didn't even know such a thing was legal. For some bizarre reason, I went ahead and ate it. Yes. It is as disgusting as it sounds. I ordered a build your own bowl with rice, steak and veggies. The rice was gloppy. The steak was STEAMED. Sooooo gross. Expensive. The people working there not very friendly. My curiosity has been satisfied. There won't be a repeat visit.

I WANT to love this place.  I work nearby and tried the order online/pickup route.  I'm on an HCG diet ...so it was $14 for a Chinese food rice size box of veggies with an ounce of meat.  You get used to over -paying on HCG.  The HCG diet is full of disappointing lunch take out options - but hey - with this I could go the pick up route and specify no cheese, sauce on the side etc.  The website makes you pay with a credit card but when I showed up for pick up, I was told I had to pay at the store.  The food was ok.  but I noticed 2 days later I was double charged.  I tried to call and complain but while on hold for the manager I was hung up on.  I gave them a 2nd chance today.  I paid $20+ today for a $6 12 oz juice drink (I have a cold..am obviously also in the wrong business) and a $10 lunch entree minus cheese, nuts and olives. I picked up my order but they didn't have my juice..,,when I asked, they quickly found it in the fridge.  I left, confident because my box had the name of my dish written on the side.  Got back to work and it was completely wrong.  It had cheese, it had black beans and essentially made me super sad I gave them a second chance and spent $14 on a box of spinach and shrimp where I picked around half of it off.  Overall I'm just disappointed - wondering where my money went and had that sad, shitty monday where you opened up an entree box and see a bunch of stuff you can't eat.  I have expectations - I waited tables a ton and my parents owned a restaurant.  I just expect $20 food when I buy $20 food.

I enjoyed the Mediterranean salad with Tofu.  They do charge extra for protein added and $2 extra for the amount that was added....was too much.  With that said, I'd go back again, order the same salad with no extra protein and dressing on the side.  Prefer to be able to add the dressing to my taste - believe less is more!  Anyways,  on a side note, there was some nice eye candy there that day.  The men that were there having lunch --- WOW!  I'm not a cougar...but if I was one, I'd go there for lunch on a Saturday again.  Teehee!

I really really really wanted to like this place. I even went out of my meat to pick up lunch here I wanted to try it so bad. Had the Tokyo Bay with chicken. Yes, It's healthy, clean eating, love the concept, but what you get feels like leftover mushy slop, smooshed into a small box all jumbled up together with a weird sauce that just doesn't 'go'. It was one of those mmmmm yummmm....errrr...sad face. Healthy food, bad flavor combinations.

Want to eat and drink healthy?  That is exactly what this place is about.  I've liked every thing I've ordered!  A bit pricey on some items... regardless overall pleased with the place and the staff.  It's clean and bright.

I'm surprised there are such negative reviews for this place. Yes, it is a little overpriced so I probably can't go as often as I want to but it was soooo good! Plus, I spend more at places like paradise bakery or ajs and I'd rather eat here. It's so hard to find really healthy places with these kinds of options.  The portions are good, I wasn't full after and I eat a lot. People  who commented on the smell...I didn't really notice but they steam everything so it's just veggie stank.

This place is amazing. You must eat here if you are in the North Scottsdale area! Came here today around 12:30 for lunch for the first time and I definitely left very happy! I had to wait in line for a few minutes but was glad because I did not know what to order. I got the Southwest which was amazing. Definitely recommend it! I waited for my food for about 5 minutes and came out right away. There is lots of seating inside and a good amount of seating outside too! I decided to sit outside since it was nice out and there is shade from the sun so I was pleased by that. Everyone that works there is super nice, helpful and gets the job done. The menu here is so big I want to eat all of it. They have bowls and have smoothies and acai bowls and everything a health nut can think of. I love how easy it is to find as well and there is a ton of parking right by. I definitely will be coming here a lot more for a quick and easy lunch!

Still really like GrabbaGreen. I love stopping in for a smoothie or fresh juice. Everyone that works there has always been incredibly friendly and helpful (Shout out to Jeremy). My favorite items are the energy elevator smoothie (add almond butter and cinnamon). So good and big enough to be a meal. A number of their juices a great and you can also design your own combos.
