Their southwestern style salad (can't remember the name) with steak is excellent. And you have to add their awesome hot sauce! I noticed they added quite a few healthy breakfast items to the menu. I'm excited to try them!
Healthy and delicious! All of the breakfast items are awesome, which is great considering they serve breakfast all day!

Bland food and cheap ingredients lead to a disappointing meal and a guarantee not to return

Went with the French Quarter with extra shrimp, and for $13 you would expect at least mid sized shrimp, not the baby shrimp that it comes with, also coming in a to go container that Whole Foods uses.  It was pretty bland, not terrible, however the uncooked red onion was a bit overpowering.  I would certainly never want to eat this again, and could make the same thing with better shrimp for half the price.  Medium sized shrimp on the high side are $8.

The acai bowl we ordered was not really even an acai bowl, i would rate it a 1 

We ordered the cococabana which had banana in it, even though it is not listed as an ingredient on the menu, also it was served in a smoothy cup, (serve it in the right vessel) and was not pleasant tasting

The mixed reviews here should be a warning to you (a warning I ignored) 

If you have taste buds and don't want to be disappointed, you can steer clear of Grabbagreen

If there was a 3 1/2 that's would I would rate my experience today. First timer. Had the Orange County Salad. The box is awkward to eat from. Trying to hold the flap down is a pain. I had read you can ask for a plate so we got plates. For some reason I thought it would be something more substantial but it was a paper plate. Salad itself  was good. But I am not a fan of hot food on a salad. And the chicken was hot. No mention of it anywhere. Ick. Not sure if I'll go back.

Healthy, nutritious, filling, simple. 

Because there's the option to create your own bowl, the potential for things to go awry is there. If you don't trust yourself, just order one of the set items on the menu. You can always get a little crazy and sub out proteins for one another.

I had quinoa + salmon + kale + pistachios + avocado + and some Asian-y dressing, and it totally hit the spot. Could I have made it myself? Yes, but WOULD I have made it myself is the real question.

Overall? grabbagreen is worth the 10 buckaroos if you order shrimp or salmon in your bowl. Otherwise, I'd call it steep, but it's definitely worth a visit if you're in the area and pressed for time.

Meh. Bland and not much bang for the buck. It's not horrible, but lacking in many ways. Good for those I suppose who aren't used to clean eating but may also deter a lifestyle change as well. I love to cook clean and am known for my amazing salads and bowls so I may be a harsh critic. Steaming is generally not a flavor boost for chicken. Everything needed a little salt and pepper and was missing a flavor palate. Was hoping this might be a good spot for the hubs to grab lunch which is why we checked it out. He called it a 'one and done' experience. Go to Urbane or Sharky's. Or food prep and make your own bowls and salads all week. So easy. Fyi, we had the Tokyo and southwestern.

I always see this place but had never gone. I looked up the menu to see what the food was really made of, and I was very pleasantly surprised. I was the only one in the store at the time, so I got my food really fast, my order was correct, and it was really good. I like how they have nutrition information on their website, so I know how many calories I'm eating. The only thing that could be more user friendly is the boxes for the to go food. I ordered a salad and it was a little challenging to eat because the box was not big enough for the amount of food, but that does not alter my overall experience. I felt full for a while after eating here, which is nice to find in a salad. I will be back for sure.

Grabbagreen is a small eatery specializing in fresh, natural (no preservatives) foods, and they are 100% gluten free.  They have tons of smoothie and juice options if you want a liquid meal. For others, there are salads (greens) and "bowls", which they call "grains". I opted for the latter. 

I made my own. For the grain I mixed quinoa and brown rice. My protein choice was black beans. You get to pick 5 nutrients and I got spinach, corn, red onion, edamame, and avocado. I skipped the cheese option (of course). Cilantro was my herb of choice, and I got the Spicy Almond dressing.  My meal was a carry-out order and it came in a little brown box, but the box was heavy; you could tell that they packed it in really good. 

It was very delicious and everything tasted quite fresh.  The Spicy Almond truly had some kick, which was awesome. It has a flavor that is slightly reminiscent of a yellow curry.  I also added some chili mango hot sauce to it after seeing the bottle. Yum yum!  I was very full after eating this, so I felt that it was worth the $10.  I think next time I'll only eat 1/2 and save the rest for another day.  

There are lots of options for vegans here, and many of their dressings for the greens and grains are vegan (look for the "V" by the name).  The acai cups looked yummy too. I'll have to stop by and have one for breakfast one day.

The only thing they're missing is vegan dessert. (They had some non-vegan cookies.)

Clean establishment. Friendly workers.  Located in the strip mall on the SE corner of FLW and the 101, before you cross under the hwy for eastbound traffic; after the hwy for wb traffic (in the parking lot with Best Buy). Lots of parking spaces. 
There were 2 designated parking spaces for call ahead, pick-up orders.
My 14 year cannot get enough of this place! When she had done something really good this place is her treat.  She goes crazy for their smoothies.
Love this place. A variety of healthy and DELICIOUS Options. The pb and j smoothie is super filling and yummy. Coming

Update 5/20: I'd love for everyone to read the below owner comment. Being condescending and passive aggressive is never cute, folks. 

Per the owner: "Wow J'enay, you are the first person who has not found anything on our menu appealing!  We understand our food is "healthy" food so it may not appeal to everyone."

So basically I am the only person who didn't care for their menu, thus my opinion must be invalid, and apparently I don't know how to eat healthy. Hmm... Let's call this what it is: I don't like your menu, so I eat like garbage and don't know good food when I see it. Ok folks. FYI, Keely N, we eat extremely healthy in our house. Your menu is simply not appealing. This would be why my friend and I both left without food - but perhaps she doesn't know good food, either. 

On to my original review.......... 


Overpriced and absolutely not worth it. And let's be real here. All the fake five star reviews are pretty obvious... A friend and I stopped in here to grab a quick bite, but after realizing that nothing on their menu sounded appealing to us, I decided to just grab a juice and go. First of all, it took three girls more than ten minutes just to make my juice; note we were the only people being served. For $7, I expect more than a tiny cup of juice. I don't even think I was given a full measuring cup of juice, and what I did finally receive was not what I ordered.

And for GOD'S sake. Please stop having each of your 80 staff members ask your customers over and over and over and over and OVER if they have questions. Trust me; if we have questions, we'll ASK.
Great customer service and amazing healthy food! My gift card wasn't working and the young man immediately fixed the solution and made it a great experience!

Zero complaints about this place. Uniquely presented, good selection, and prices "are expected", nice location and everything is fresh. The staff's service is rather informative, nice, and quick. I'd go back quite a few times during work.

grabbagreen is a little silly. i appreciate the premise and i like to support places that give it their best to serve healthy food, but this is just a little off.

juices are $7+; that's a travesty. there is not 12oz of juice in existence worth $7. "juice cleanses" are not a real thing - please google it. do not buy juice here.

the food boxes are pretty decent. they definitely do exactly what they say they will do: toss a bunch of fresh and healthy ingredients together in a bowl. i appreciate that they do brown rice and quinoa and udon noodles, and a nice mix of veggie and protein options. kudos for having those options.

unfortunately almost all of the dishes are super bland. sorry guys!!! i still like you. it's just not a great meal for like $11. 

i will keep trying to see if things gets better. but for now.........skip it

god bless

robbo
a bit expensive for acai in a cup, not a bowl. but overwell good place to grab lunch or a snack. menu was pretty straightforward and easy to see/read. good place to chill

Inconsistent menu item preparation and staff that lacks enthusiasm or a willingness to be engaging has sealed the deal for me in this place. I won't be coming back. 

I went in the other night (8:15-ish) after a workout for some protein and ordered the collard wrap with chicken. The first time I'd ordered it (a couple weeks prior), the collard leaves were a bright beautiful green and wrapped snugly around the filling. It was yummy and I was looking forward to capping my evening with a small healthy dinner. 

The two people working were cleaning and took their sweet time acknowledging I was even there as I stood waiting at the register. They went back and forth a couple times and finally the girl walked over. Come on... When a customer walks in, ESPECIALLY if there are zero other people waiting, and you're purposely going to make them wait while you finish up something, then SAY something about that. Completely unprofessional. 

The gal took my order, I got the box, and drove home. Upon opening it I was pretty floored at the difference between what I was given that night and what I'd had the first time. Yellowed collard leaves were *laying* in the bottom of the container with the filling just spooned over the top of them. 

Do you guys have no pride in your work? Do you give two sh*ts at all about what you present to your customers and its quality? I've seen other reviews documenting the same complaint so it appears this is a chronic problem. And I do not accept any argument along the lines of, "Well, it's a fast food joint after all." Please. Let me point you to the enthusiasm of the staff at In-And-Out and their happy, fun-loving attitudes, and the consistency of their food prep. Or maybe the folks over at Five Guys hollering out a greeting to people when they walk in the door. And there are plenty more...

In the other reviews I've also seen responses saying "We've replaced some staff, please come give us another try." I don't accept that either. What's the common denominator here after staff has been replaced? Management. This is squarely on you who run the place and set the example. You are obviously missing something and that is painfully obvious in the consistent poor performance.

Change management, change attitude, get some experience. Your values are in the wrong place and until that's addressed with some vigor you will continue to be just another mediocre joint trying to push healthy alternatives and never quite making it.

This place is great....so many varieties of healthy items. I love the fact that I can double my protein especially on those workout days. I just discovered their Moroccan  Mac & Cheese made with Quinoa mac noodles.  A healthy alternative to Mac & Cheese I added broccoli as recommended. I will be back again and again.

First time here - just wanted to pick up some smoothies. 
Awesome selection of combos, clean establishment, super friendly staff, I was served quickly and offered a punch card.
Prices are a bit on the high side ($7 smoothies / $10 boxed meal) I would love to become a regular if it were a bit more affordable. Was hoping for better pricing.
Healthy and tasty, just uber expensive. Parking sort of sucks if you hit the peak hours as it does for everything else in this plaza. Good for a once in a while place for me.

Cool place. Lots of new stuff to try and a variety of healthy options. I got the Indochin and it was delicious. A bit pricey for my liking but all fast food in the area is about $10 a meal, so they are on par with the market. I was even able to get a military discount! Thank you! 

The 4/5 stars comes from the physical location of the restaurant. It is very crowded and awkward to sit in there. Tables are inches from one another and its not very accepting. Also this was the first time I ate at this restaurant so when my food was done the guy just hands me a little box, which was my food. Its similar to a Chinese take out box. This may just be me, but this box was beating me. I had a hard time getting my food out of there, and when I stuck my hand in it usually got covered with the spicy almond sauce from the lid of the box. I really did not like eating out of that box... A plate would be amazing, or even a hinged box on one side that opens.

The drinks were absolutely delicious! I was feeling under the weather and have the "heel" juice!! The service could've been better older gentleman who was the cashier was not very friendly and very short with questions, however the juice was so good it over powered his shortcomings - and I'll definitely be back!! With improvements to customer service this place would absolutely be my go to!
Great food, great smoothies. HUGE list of options for both. Not a lot of places offer maca or hemp in a $7 smoothie. Love it.

It's nice having a somewhat healthy place in the Phoenix metro area. This place is a tad bit overpriced I feel. I went in and basically just wanted a bunch of veggies...like a veggie platter. I was happy that they were able to accommodate my request since there is no such thing on the menu. Lesson learned....ORDER OFF THE MENU. This thing cost me $18! It seriously was broccoli, spinach, corn, green onions, cauliflower, cucumber, edamame, and some olives. Lord! 

Aside from this...definitely try one of their smoothies. During a different visit I tried their oxidation eliminator smoothie and it was the best smoothie I have ever had!
20 bucks for a salad that I could've done at home . Plus no flavor. I'm deff not going back.
Stood waiting for over 3 minutes. The guy never acknowledged me. Not "be right with you". No care. And I was the only customer inside

This small little green eatery is a great alternative to the many waist-unfriendly choices in the area. With a versatile menu open to customization, pretty much any eater could find something delicious here. It definitely has that "healthy" vibe that screams, "Stop here for a post-gym replenishment! If you weren't at the gym, at least put on some yoga pants!" which seems to deter some more traditional folks. But I hope it continues to attract a large dining crowd.

The food is simple and delicious. I've enjoyed a few of their salads, and I would definitely recommend requesting dressing on the side. I not only found them to be generously poured when added in advance, but they were a little sweet for my taste. My husband loves the quinoa bowls and finds them sufficient in actually squashing his appetite - a rare feat at most health-centric dining venues. He's also praised their smoothies, a treat I have yet to experience.

My only other concern and hesitation toward coming here more often is the time it takes from ordering to eating. It appears as though everything is mostly cooked in advance and ready for assembly, yet it took almost a half hour the last time we grabbed lunch on a Saturday. The menu may have a variety, but none of it is complicated. If they devise some sort of system to improve the wait time, the whole implication behind grabbing something to go (as the name suggests) will be much more true to form.

Healthy, Tasty & Gluten Free!!!

Having gone gluten free and egg free two weeks ago (yes, I'm counting) I've been on a quest for places to dine that meet my dietary restrictions, and provide tasty nutritious food.  I was delighted to discover Grabba Green.  

Before visiting them, I spent quite a bit of time on their website.  In addition to giving up glutens and eggs due to sensitivities, I have to balance my carbs and proteins so that each meal I consume has at least as many proteins as carbohydrates. Their website identifies the ingredients in each of their menu items.  Access to 
nutritional breakdown information is available as well.  I was able to develop a list of which menu offerings fit my needs whether "as is" or with some tweaking of the ingredients.  This may not be important to most people, but it really was helpful to me.  It was also very cool that their online menu has a feature where if you click on the item, it shows you a picture of the menu item, clearly showing all of the ingredients.

I arrived at around noon on a Monday, and it thankfully wasn't too busy.  The restaurant offered only counter service, but was clean and pleasant with a fair amount of table space.  Their menu includes wraps and paninis, and meals (bowls) with either grains or greens as the foundation to which other combinations of ingredients are added.  They also offer breakfast items, a variety of smoothies, healthy snacks, and prepared and made to order juices.  

The young man who waited on me was super friendly, and took time to verify for me that the dressing for the salad I was ordering "On The Border" didn't have eggs or egg products in it.  That information was not on their website, although Vegan salad dressings were identified as such.  He was also happy to help me reason through how to boost the protein in smoothies that were generally too carb heavy for me to consider otherwise.

Once I ordered, my "On the Border" salad (Spinach, Chicken, Avocado, Black Bean, Red Pepper, Tomato, Cilantro, Cheddar Jack, Yogurt Agave BBQ dressing) didn't take long to prepare.  It came in a brown box with enough weight to feel pretty substantial.  10 minutes later, at home, I was delighted with my salad.  The use of ingredients was generous and well balanced, everything was very fresh, it smelled wonderful, and the flavors were very good.  

It wasn't cheap, but I thought that the prices were reasonable for the quality of the food.  I absolutely plan to be eating at Grabba Green again soon.  I already know what I'll have next time!

I've gone here a couple times now that I work in Scottsdale and it's only 5 minutes away. I made my own juice when I was convinced I was getting sick and that was tasty. I also made my own smoothie which tastes good for the most part but the espresso left a weird after taste, not super noticeable though. My only issue was with my "grab your own" the quinoa noodles were in one block of noodles and my shrimp was left out, but I did get there 10 minutes after they opened so I really don't blame them for forgetting some things since it was so early. It is also a little expensive for the portion (except for the smoothie! That was pretty large!) of the grab your own but again it's Scottsdale AND health food so it could be much much worse. I really enjoy all of their vegan options available and the staff I've interacted with are very nice and engaging! Will definitely be eating there more, maybe just not the quinoa noodles.
Oh! I also absolutely love the app they have so I can place an order to pick up without having to make a phone call!

I LOVE this place!!! I'm from LA and this place would fit in perfectly there! The juices are delicious and so good for you! They have an array of options for healthy foods, it's not that it's just healthy its actually delicious! If I live here I'd come often! The service was beyond friendly!

Fresh as can be, not like the disappointment of Zoeys, which false advertises their so-called freshness.  GrabbaGreen does it Right!  Fresh, clean and healthy, they completely rock! And the staff kicks ass.
I am addicted to this place.. they offer great selection of healthy and great-flavored breakfasts, lunch, and dinner.. if you only eat in one place, you will never be bored with these varieties.

All I want to GRABBA is the TRASHA!

Are you trying to KILL ME?  This is yet another reason WHY YELP needs a negative star rating.  Are you guys in Phoenix checking your taste buds at the door before entering and eating here?

I have had more acai bowls than I can count.  If you know me you KNOW I HATE NANAS!  Thus this is ALWAYS a hurdle I must jump over  when I want an acai bowl.

That said I will lead you through the DIS-ASTER called an ACAI BOWL!  I saw this place passing by while on a business trip.  I can't remember where I was going but I filed it in my mental roller deck to check out.

So I'm HANGRY and I stop near by to pick up a small salad.  I remember this place so after I GRABBA-SALAD I GRABBAGREEN!  And that is when everything went horribly WRONG!

I park and walk in and the place is empty.  I scan the menu and see acai bowl and ask what size they are.  I was shown a smaller size that cost more than they do back home in SoCal and where they are much bigger.  But ok I will go ahead and try one to go with my salad.

I got the ....  It came with mango, pineapple and coconut on top.  I placed my order paid and watched as the young lady made my bowl.  I was pretty clear to not use nanas and to use a different fruit like strawberries, raspberries instead.  It didn't seem to be a problem when she rang me up.

I watched as she made my acai bowl and they DON'T USE frozen acai.  They use some sort of liquid acai.  She didn't put in much but I figured she knew what she was doing.  She did add what looked like a nana and a half. OMG this is going to be a hot NASTY MESS!  

As she was mixing I mentioned I didn't want nans and she said....oh I didn't add many it part of it.  Ok I feel a smart azz coming on.  Why can I not just get what I ORDERED and WHAT I PAID FOR!  If it is going to be a problem then shouldn't the little BRAT have told me that when I was ordering and let me make the choice to NOT ORDER THAT and get something else?

So ok she proceeds.  When she was finished it was a BROWN UGLY SLOP!  BROWN !  Who ever head of a BROWN acai bowl.  Acai bowls are red-ish or burgundy in color, which is WHY they have the name ACAI!  Also it should be the MAIN INGREDIENT NOT a minor ingredient!  

I took it back to my hotel and tried it. It was HORRID!  It was some sort of NANA smoothie with mango and pineapple!  WRETCHED! INTO THE ROUND FILE AKA TRASH!  What an utter waste of moola!  

Is this what how Phoenix does acai bowls?  If so they should all CLOSE UP SHOP ASAP!    I guess you can tell I WILL NOT BE BACK!  How DREADFUL!
expensive but good, 10 dollars for my fav grain bars but hey worth it. Its a meal in itself.

I have tried Grabbagreen multiple times. I have tried everything from the bowls to the soups, once I did a smoothie (this was alright) but everything i have tried had absolutely no taste. Last night I ordered the grabba chili--do not let it fool you! This is just hot TAP water with no flavoring, and the small amount of vegetables that were placed in the soup were not even cooked properly (crunchy and hard). I have been extremely disappointed every time I have gone here. I understand its healthy but it doesn't mean it should lack flavor! Please work on your recipes and for the love of god open a cook book and fix the chili! I make tea that tastes better.

I've been three times and ordered the same thing each time - the French Quarter.  It's very tasty, healthy and a great "fast food" option.  The prices are a bit high but I will  spend the $10 for something quick, filling and healthy.  This is my new go-to spot on the days that I don't bring my lunch to work.
This place is fast, clean, taste really good. Everyone is cool there and ready to tend to you
